description:
I've been coming here for years and it never fails. The food, the staff and the vibrance is terrific - as too are the micheladas! It has such a community feel and anyone and everyone feels welcomed warmly. The prices are incredibly reasonable too which is pretty rare now in the city.

Muchos gracias!
author: Foofa B.

description:
Unfortunately, not a fan. 

Ordered: regular chicken burrito

Chicken is okay, nothing special. What really threw me off was the existence of peas in my burrito. Tortilla was not toasted; cold tortilla with lukewarm fillings equates to not the best combination. Rice was a bit too soft. I don't know, it's just not my favorite. 

Service was kind of meh. Straight, to the point but no real friendliness. 

There are better options elsewhere.
author: Elisabeth H.

description:
Service is horrible. Americanized and heated meats. Not what I like. 

The girls taking the orders are not pleasant.

The cashier is always in a bad mood and if you ask them for a napkin or if you ask them for any other request they pretend not to hear you or react rudely.
author: Jayden R.

description: Amazing meats! Absolutely delicious but the tacos only come with meat and beans. It wasn't dressed. Nothing special but I would say the meat here is better than Pancho Villa and La Tacqueria
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
This venue isn't as gritty and old school as some of the other taquerias in the Mission and San Francisco but it's impressive nevertheless. On a recent afternoon they even had a 4 member band playing which is a classy touch.

The owner was present and he has a very politician-ish vibe and I've read that he's done a lot of community work which is awesome.  This is their third location I believe along with Diamond Heights and Burlingame.  The attention to detail at this venue is very impressive I think it appeals to both tourists and those looking for an authentic venue. The owner himself is from Jalos (Mexican state of Jalisco) and based on the success of his restaurants seems to have this Taqueria thing down pat. 

You walk in the impressive facility and put your order in.
I noted this in a review for a Filpino spot that I recently reviewed, having a long counter in establishments like this is crucial. Some have them others do not. If you have that long counter it feels like you are steadily creeping up the line even though the time duration is the same.  This place has that "ideal" layout and once you reach the end the cashier has your order and you're on your way. 

I had two tacos :
Al Pastor 
Cochinita Pibil

The tacos were flavorful and solid. Another added plus is that this venue accepts credit/debit card which not all Taquerias do.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market

10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description:
La Corneta Taqueria is a large updated Taqueria with 3 flatscreens, 2nd floor dining. bar and  large wall mural. 

offerings: tacos, quesadillas, nachos, regular/seafood/vegeterian burritos, combos, specials, 

drill: order while in line, items prep from premade ingredients. pay at cashiers. 

eats: tostada de ceviche(3.50)
-good portion, vinegared bland fish cubes, tomato, avocado.
-the usual, not extraordinary
3.5 stars

frijoles refritos:
-large portions seen on waiting orders, reasonable pricing
-chips stored in 45 gal. plastic container. homemade?
-didn't eat proteins yet. if fresh, etc. good deal..
author: Victor G.

description:
A very good, solid taqueria with plenty of room to sit and eat - that's a real plus when traveling with a hungry group (many nearby taquerias have very limited seating).

I ordered the mole enchilada plate for $10 - a great deal for a lot of food (two enchiladas, beans, rice, corn tortillas and a small pile of lettuce "salad?")

Chips were good, but wished they had spicy salsas instead of pico de gallo (it was okay, not amazing).

Overall, I liked the place quite a bit  - worthy of a solid 4 stars.
author: Patrick L.

description: We went recently here to experience the Mexican food at 24th mission San Francisco. It's a very old restaurant and it's always busy( even on weekdays). The non vegetarian burritos were pretty good as told by my friends. We also tried the supper veggie option and that was decent. It had a lot more rice in it than beans.  The food is very affordable overall and our service was quick too.
author: Bhawna J.

description:
Mission is always doling out the best Mexican food, so you can't really make a bad choice when choosing a spot here. Nonetheless, used Yelp to find this restaurant - highly rated for it's burritos and plethora of options/seating.

Sunday afternoon and the line was moving quickly. Ordered the Steak Super Burrito ($10) and a beer ($4). Food is assembled in front of you within minutes as you walk down the line to pay. Along with the large burrito given to me, they also throw in some free chips and salsa (always a plus). The burrito is amazing - a hefty pile of rice, black beans, guac, cheese, sour cream, lettuce, tomato, and steak rolled tightly within a soft tortilla. Didn't really need any hot sauce and it's amazingly filling. Chips were good, but was way too full from the meal to make a solid dent in them.

Service is super efficient and the pricepoint is perfect. Must-stop if in the area.
author: Shaji K.

description:
I have been coming to La Corneta for about 8 to 9 years now but I have to give them a wake up call. They messed up my order then the Supervisor ordered the young lady to remove the chicken portion off my plate and only leave the beef carne asada this left me with half portion of meat since my original order was for a full order of carne asada. I asked the supervisor if he was kidding and if he was not going to give me a full order, and he laughed in my face, I then asked him to just then leave the chicken he took off my plate and he laughed again handing me my plate.  Are you kidding me?  I paid over $15 for this plate. Wow.   A bad review on Yelp is the least they will get, what happened to this place?

I am not coming here no more, their customer service service is to the ground!!!!!!


Sorry Mission but there are way better taquerias stil
author: Juan J.

description:
First, this is the cleanest taqueria in The Mission. Thumbs up! Second, they take card unlike most spots around here. Another thumbs up! Third, prices are some of the best I've seen in The City. Extra extra thumbs up!!

Started with the tostada de ceviche and I have to say that was the best tostada I've had outside of Mexico. Add some of the habanero salsa and it was out of this world. Super spicy but amazing flavor! $3.50

Super carne asada quesadilla was delicious! Big flour tortilla over stuffed with meat, cheese, guacamole, cream and lettuce. Not usually a fan of lettuce in my burritos/quesadillas but I wasn't mad at  this one. Also came with a tiny Caesar salad which I loved. $9.20!!!!!

I'm coming back for the prawn tacos/burrito next time. I saw a couple pass by and they looked great!
author: Kyle L.

description: My favorite taco in the mission. Huge delicious tacos at an amazing value. Most everything is good, but really, get some tacos.
author: Edward F.

description:
Experience: 3/5 

Wait time: Less than 10 minutes.

Review: The burrito (ESpecial burrito) I had wasn't really delightful or enjoyable. The rice was a bit soggy and the flavor of the rice does not feel very enjoyable. First bite of my burrito and I knew I wasn't going to like this. I was on an empty stomach too; Usually when I'm on an empty stomach, literally everything would taste good to me. I guess I just don't like this burrito all honestly. What would be a huge improvement to this burrito would be to make it more juicy and not soggy and dry. Oh yeah! They give out free chips also too when I bought my burrito! So.. I guess that was impressive. I thought you had to pay for the extra chips! Haha.

Customer service: Awesome! The lady was really nice and explained to me each and every kind of toppings for the burrito without any frustration. 

So +1 for the chips, +1 for the burrito & +1 for the great customer service and efficiency.

Will I be back? Maybe. It really depends on how they will make the burrito next time. More juices would really be preferred for me because the burrito they made me was really really dry.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Manager suggested that number 3 which is steak & shrimp.  The thin cut steak was dry and lacking flavor as with the Shrimp they had no seasoning and was also a fail.  The black beans where cold the salsa was boring.  A waste of $$$ I come to San Francisco to enjoy the foods but I'm sorry to find such places that forgot Delicious Mexican food. Por Favor pónganle ganas, ( Please Put some effort into it) 

The Burrito was Ok as the Quesadilla.
author: Esteban J.

description:
Apparently, this is the spot where DIY burritos originated. You can customize your order, but nowhere near as much as chipotle. This is a good thing. You can choose between tortilla type, bean type, meat type and salsa type. According to someone I was eating with, you're supposed to be able to choose everything as they build our burrito in front of you. I just ordered with my options up front, and had no problem. 

I got the super baby burrito with chicken. It was really really good!! The verde sauce is mild and delicious! I really liked the flavor of the rice and beans. 

The flour burrito it was wrapped in was thin, and wasn't great at holding in the filling. The last quarter of my burrito was eaten with a fork. If and when I go back, I'll ask them to double wrap it. 

My dad got the gambas and said they were very good, not spicy. 

They also have really yummy drinks (horchata, agua de fresa, agua de piña, etc) and churros.
author: Julia B.

description:
Came here randomly because I didn't have cash for El Farlito. I scanned the menu and chose a regular burrito but I got and was charged for a especial burrito(with rice and cheese) They gave chips and salsa but put my burrito in the chip bag... weird. 
Anyway I was very please with my especial burrito. The beans were very yummy. The burrito was so good it should have fallen apart but it was wrapped perfectly so everything was contained. 
Pretty good but very similar to other taquerias in the area.
author: Megan M.

description:
La Corneta was in my rotation of local Mexican spots I needed to try in the neighborhood. I came with the intention of comparing this place to El Farolito down the street, and it is definitely comparable. 

My burrito was a great price (around $9) and filled with everything I could ever dream of - guacamole, salsa, etc. It even came with chips and salsa (compared to El Farolito, which charges you like 60 cents for chips and salsa). I wish I had eaten in the restaurant too, which is not something I ever think when I'm at El Farolito because of the small space and crowds. This place had no line, a lot of seating, and bright decorations in comparison. What I liked the most was that there was a built-in bar option, which I didn't partake in that night but would love to enjoy in nights to come.

Overall I think this is a great substitute to El Farolito if you're looking for a quieter, more relaxing experience with comparable food.
author: Jenny D.

description: I use really love this spot. Now the employees have changed and they are not as nice as the old ones especially the young ladies who take the orders just not as attentive. They have gotten my order wrong a few times. The food is still good though.
author: Lydia V.

description:
The cafeteria style ordering at La Corneta makes tacos to mouth possible in 5 seconds flat!

Ok, kidding. It takes less than 10 minutes to put together your food, so munch on the gratis chips and salsa while you wait. 

Also, take in your surroundings: it's actually clean! and the rich painted murals on the wall of the Birhen Maria will make you thoughtfully chew on your fish tacos while praying to the gods. You even get the choice of salmon or tilapia as your fish! (get the super fish tacos for $6 each and it comes with the works!) 

For those of you who are not trying to eat healthy, the carnitas tacos are juicy, soft and just a bomb of flavor explosion in your mouth! ay carumba! una mas por favor ... 

If only the churros weren't dry and bland tasting, I would've awarded this taqueria chain a solid 5 stars.
author: Janice C.

description: Great food and the price wasn't bad. They gave such big potions to. The portion might as well been for two people. Good food for the quantity of food. We will be back for sure.
author: Anthony O.

description:
Server was pleasant.

Music was WAAAAAAAAAAAAAY too LOUD!!!!

The beer was FLAT.

The food was disgusting.

Sorry guys, but the only thing authentic about this place was the decor.

I honestly cannot believe this place gets 4 Stars when there is an endless list of other taquerias in the area that probably serve way better food at a better price.

I would bet most of these reviews are from Silicone Valley transplants that wouldn't know a good burrito from their elbows.

And finally to the cook: Can't you take the time to remove the seeds from the chili relleno? Lazy.

I grew up in a Puerto Rican household. My mother makes the best homemade chili rellenos EVER! What YOU guys call a chili relleno is only fit for the garbage can. I couldn't even swallow the second bite.

Total waste of money.
author: Danny O.

description: Amazing experience. We got the Super Burrito with steak, same ingredients as any other burrito but with a very fresh taste. Free chips and salsa when you dine in. Perfect place for a quick delicious and cheap bite to eat
author: Garrett W.

description:
If you want to feel in Mexico- this is the place! 
Great food- we ordered tacos, nachos, and churros. We were surprised by the mexican musicians and the instruments they were playing! It was an amazing experience. Everyone was friendly and super helpful. We even danced to the songs! 
Must go if you are in mission!
author: Parnika B.

description: Clean and friendly place with live music and a nice energy! Got the baby regular burrito and it was pretty good. Chips provided and the salsa was great
author: Alin C.

description:
I enjoyed the Glen Park La Corneta I used to frequent when I lived closer to there since it was the only decent Mexican place around. The food was consistently fresh, flavorful, and hit the spot. Other Mexican places are like a drunken guilty pleasure, very heavy on the grease and lard factor, leaving you with a irksome tummy or burrito hangover. It's not the case with La Corneta - so I was curious to check out the equally conveniently located next to a BART (24th St), though this one has more competition nearby. 

I got my usual Pollo asado dinner plate, hold the rice, with refried beans. The chicken was tender, not tough or dry, and not too greasy. Refried beans were what you'd expect, flavorful, and creamy texture. While the food itself not heavy and oil laden, with the grill being in front of you as you wait in line, the smell of cooking oils lingered on my clothes afterwards. Chips and salsa come with your order and there's a salsa bars but not as extensive as Pancho Villa. It's a good deal for the price, good portion size, line moves fast, and lots of seating.
author: Truc N.

description: Losing stars for very poor customer service and lots of attitude! I must say I have had some good meals here, but it's hard to communicate with the people taking the orders if you don't speak Spanish to them. I tried to order a taco salad -Aftering ordering what I thought was a going to be a salad because i did ask for taco salad and was directed to their- fish tostada, it showed up with no lettuce, when I request lettuce the woman who took my order and delivered my food to the table says in a huff- that's extra!! Really ?? I just spent $11 and you're telling me the lettuce I could have asked you for 10 mins ago is now extra? Sooo hubs stands in another 10 min line at the counter ... For lettuce . Now both our food is cold. Total lunch fail.
author: Coco J.

description: The best nachos and margaritas. The carnitas is one of the best in the city and their prices are super affordable. A great go to spot.
author: Cam R.

description: One of 3 Mexican Restaurants in the Mission District I go to when I'm over in that area of the city. The other two being Pancho Villa on 16th Street between Mission and Valencia streets, and the other one is El Toro on 17th and Valencia. They use fresh ingredients for all their food and I really love their steak and prawn burrito. It is really really good.
author: Bobby J.

description:
This is a large sit down Mexican restaurant with a fairly large selection of things to order. It's located among a large number of Mexican eateries on Mission Street. Seating is abundant and during lunch time there normally is a line, but it goes by pretty quick as they push out freshly made orders fairly fast. There's also a mariachi band sometimes which can either be a good or bad thing.

I normally order my standard carne asada super baby burrito and that normally fills me up. For about $7+ you get a decent size burrito with meat, cheese, lettuce, sour cream, rice, and salsa, plus a small bag of chips. What a deal! Though it's not my favorite or the most delicious tasting burrito, this place has great prices and value for their food. The service is also very fast compared to other places. Definately a win in my book!
author: Melissa N.

description: Had a steak super burrito and thoroughly enjoyed it. I like that they offer whole wheat and spinach tortillas. The carne asada was higher quality meat than I've had at other Mission burrito joints. It also came with a nice sized portion of tortilla chips.
author: Michael S.

description: The food is great. It's one of my go to place for Mexican food and sometimes they have live bands like today. It definitely sets the mood. Super clean. Love this place over all.
author: Cheh S.

description: Worst delivery ever. I ordered vegetarian food, the restaurant even called to confirm and let me know they were missing an item. However, when the order arrived, it had chicken in it. WTF. It was so simple. 2 cheese enchiladas and roasted veggies on the side - instead 1 cheese 1 chicken. Of course I bit into the chicken one. I'm beyond grossed out. Never again.
author: H. M.

description:
If I want taco-truck style, Mexican food in San Francisco, this is where I go. It's hard to go wrong with their burritos. Huge interior, plenty of seating, clean restrooms, good friendly service, and open fairly late.
And yes, I've been known to drive completely across town just to go to this place -- on more than one occasion.
author: Al B.

description:
I know everyone loves La Taq and you can see the line snaking outside the restaurant sometimes, but I think it's overrated and overpriced and I actually prefer Pancho Villa or this little gem, La Corneta Taqueria. The location is super convenient, just half a block away from the 24th St. BART station (between 23rd and 24th on Mission St.), the restaurant is decently sized - maybe the same size as Pancho Villa and maybe 30-40% bigger than La Taq.

The portions here are generous in size - I got the Super Baby Burrito (sounds like an oxymoron!), but it's a smaller sized burrito that comes with meat, rice, beans, cheese, salsa, sour cream, guacamole, lettuce, tomato and salsa for $7. You can get just the Baby Burrito for $5.50, but that just comes with the meat, rice, beans, cheese, and salsa, so I think it's worth the extra $1.50 for the guacamole and other things. Seeing as that a burrito at Chipotle costs just as much as this Super Baby Burrito (if not more) and it's not as authentic and flavorful, this is a much better option! The Super Baby Burrito was filling but not to the point where I thought I would explode after eating.

The fillings: you can pick between refried or black beans, you can make your burrito spicy or mild. The rice is flavorful and has peas and some other veggies in there, so it's not just plain white rice with cilantro. The chicken I got was well seasoned and a little grilled, so it was better than the chicken at La Taq that seems to just be boiled and flavorless.

If you dine in, they have 2 kinds of salsa on the table that you can squeeze on your burrito. No salsa bar like Pancho Villa. They will give you some chips too, but they were a little bit too greasy for my taste.

If burritos aren't your thing, you can also get tacos, quesadillas, nachos, or other combinations/special plates. You should be able to find something that you like here - there are a ton of options. They take credit card which is always nice (unlike La Taq that is only cash), and the space is fairly large and spacious so you won't feel like you're eating on top of someone else.

I'll definitely come back here again next time I'm in the mood for a burrito or authentic Mexican food. They have locations in Glen Park, San Carlos and Burlingame too!
author: Christina L.

description:
I had tacos here at this authentic Mexican place. They were pretty good but the meat was little dry. 

The building is very beautiful and the wall paintings are colorful and very vivid. Great authentic Mexican food restaurant/atmosphere.
author: Mete R.

description: This place is awesome, never disappointed me.  Tried many items on the menu and they're all very good, whether it's the tacos, burritos, or their combo meals.  Place got multiple TV's showing various sports (Warriors' games, World Cup soccer matches, MLB, etc.).  Served beer and mixed drinks as well.  Service fast and prompted.
author: Denis Y.

description:
I went here for the first time yesterday for lunch with a couple of friends from work. We were originally going to go to El Farolito, but when one of my work friends found out that they only take cash, we decided to walk over to La Corneta. When we walked into La Corneta, I'll admit, it was pretty cool. Plenty of seating, they have a TV towards the back, and they make the food right there in front of you.

I was able to order pretty quickly, and it was ready within 2-5 min. One of the ladies took my order. I just ordered a grilled chicken Super Burrito. LOL. Yeah, it doesn't sound as exotic as some of their other options, but I'm not going to lie, this burrito really was pretty good. Probably one of the best burritos I've had in a while. The Mission really is one of the best places to get a burrito in the city.

I sadly might not be able to go La Corneta that much because I work in Civic Center, and I rode with my work friends over there yesterday. If I go by myself, I'll have to catch BART, and allow extra time. With that being said, I definitely will go to La Corneta again though, and will add it as another one of my lunch options. Wish they had this place in Civic Center, with all due respect to the taquerias there.

But yes, La Corneta is really good, and I would recommend it.
author: Otis B.

description: As an SF native, this spot is my go-to. The prawn super burrito is my favorite menu option. Anything on the menu is my favorite menu option. Lol. I also get a carnitas quesadilla from time to time. Highly recommend for a SF burrito!
author: Isabella C.

description: Best Mexican food in the city.  Carne asada is flavorful, chicken is just as good. Unbelievable food!  5 stars all around
author: John D.

description:
It was a late Wednesday night after dance class. My boyfriend and I wanted tacos but did want to walk "all the way" to the 24th Mission BART station, so La Corneta Taqueria was a good compromise in terms of distance. This place is huge, and it looks like there's even an upstairs area.

Service is very friendly, which I appreciated. I ordered two carne asada super tacos, while my boyfriend got chicken tacos and a quesadilla. My tacos were packed with lots of ingredients but didn't have much flavor inherently. Should have doused them with more salsa or something. It was kinda disappointing. In fact, they slightly tasted better the next day when I microwaved my leftovers and poured hot sauce all over it.

This is a great place for large groups, seeing how much space there is, but the food doesn't scream "yummy" to me. I'm better off walking a few more blocks down to one of my favorite Mexican eateries, but I'm always open to trying more places on a quest to find the best Mexican food in San Francisco.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Hands down one of the better taquerias in the Mission. Their mole chicken is to die for and where else can you get a ginormous super taco loaded with delicious condiments for less than $6? It makes an affordable tasty balanced full meal here in the city and that's a steal! Service is good for the most part
 Sometimes they get distracted but this is the taqueria business after all not a fancy clean uptight cafe. Servers are pretty nice and you can always get seating. You know a taqueria is good when you see it filled with latinx families having brunch on a Saturday morning with the mariachi and all.
author: Rosanna C.

description: Could be the worst taco spot in the mission, I ordered a taco plate (3 tacos beans and rice) didn't get my rice the Al pastor was so dry thank God for sour cream, and the salsa had no flavor. Chips and salsa extremely simple yet they messed that up, the pico del gio just taste like tomatoes and onions and chips were stale u guys really got some things u need to work on your whole line set up is a mess
author: David J.

description:
I'll be honest and say I only came here because I was too lazy to go to the ATM to get cash for El Farolito and it was too crowded there anyway. This was my first time and I was very happy with my experience. I got a super burrito with carne asada (no sour cream), a small cream-filled churro, and a Mexican Coke. The burrito was amazing!! It was an awesome replacement for El Farolito and I almost ate it all in one sitting. I'm very picky about burritos and it's hard to please me in this area. Most of the time, burritos can be too dry or have too much of a filler in it. Their burrito had the perfect amount of ingredients and everything tasted fresh and was seasoned well.

The only disappointment was the churro. It was too crunchy for my liking and didn't seem very fresh. It almost seemed stale to me? Maybe I'm just spoiled by the Churros Mexicanos cart in Fruitvale... But El Corneta's churro relleno did not meet my expectations.

I was also very happy with the service here. The two young ladies who helped me were very attentive even though they seemed swamped with orders. The lady who ordered before me was rude to them and almost ran out with MY burrito because she wouldn't listen to what they were saying. Some of y'all customers need to chill and be more respectful to workers. Thankfully, they were able to stop her from running away with my burrito. 

I have no idea why some people are saying this taqueria is cash only. They accept cards too! Also, this place is very spacious and there's A/C. It's the perfect place to get lunch in the summer if you're in the area.
author: Karen R.

description:
Delicious ! Just brought our group of 13 Girl Scouts to have lunch based on a local's tip! 
So glad we followed her lead. 
We had a super vegetarian burrito and some chips and guacamole. Friendly, fast, and clean!!!!
author: Amy G.

description: You people are horrible people. You people charged my credit card twice, both times overcharging me for my order.  I have submitted a claim against you with my credit card company, I am filling a case for fraud. You people are dishonest rats. We came with a large group, of 10 people, we wanted to order at the counter, but instead your staff insisted that we sit down and order at the table. So we did, and you insisted that we pay at the table. So we had to hand our credit cards to you! You took our credit cards behind the counter and overcharged us each. I hope you go out of business! You are scum please eat dirt. DO NOT PAY WITH CREDIT CARDS!!! These people who work here are thiefs and scammers. Do not give their horrible "taqueria" any business. UNAUTHORIZED CHARGES on my card! Im also filling a report with the Better Business Bureau (BBB) so there will be records of your criminal business practices.
author: Max S.

description: Over many years of getting burritos and tacos from restaurants and food trucks all over California, this place is truly unique with their selection of meats! This is where they have several selections of mole and meat bathed in sauce. They are already made and just waiting for you at the counter in this quick-serve style. I did not see them until after I ordered a regular carne Asada burrito, so I will have to return. But it looks really good! The carne asada burrito was also good and the servers are nice. I could not communicate as well as I would have liked and should learn more Spanish! Picante, and how do you say "to-go"? At least I got gracias right!
author: Michael Y.

description:
5 stars because their Chicken is so tasty and delicate and the carnitas tiene mucho sabor.   I just ordered two carnitas tacos and I was full with just one!  the red sauce is also good; their chips are crunchy and yummy!  

bathroom was ok clean and useable but....

definitely will come back here
author: Christine A.

description: Large clean space with a great menu of options. I had a delicious chicken burrito. Ordered regular size which was still quite big! You decide what you want on it too. A special bonus was the live musicians playing during lunchtime.
author: Jennifer G.

description: Burritos are pure awesomeness. Try the prawn with green chili sauce refried beans and rice.  Live in the excelsior and the Glenn park is our go to spot for cheap and good eats. Enjoy!
author: Eli M.

description:
So you're famished after a spa day at Archimedes Banya and you're craving Mexican food ... you spy El Farolito three doors down but notice a massive line out the door. You think, "Hey, that place I just passed -- Corneta something -- is empty so that's a good place to go instead."
Stop and ask yourself why it's empty before going in there for a plate of microwaved enchiladas and dull chips.
author: Lisa T.

description:
First review of mine for 2017!  :-)  Last week, my friend and I sat at El Techo for about 5 minutes before we decided to leave (unimpressed by the menu, and I frankly didn't like the happy hour scene).  Looking and craving some Mexican food, we came to La Corneta.  The line was long, but not as excessive as the line I saw out the door earlier at El Farolito.  The colors are bright here, the restaurant is very clean, and the food looked and smells good.  While waiting, I saw the meats on the grill which permeated onto my hair and clothes.  

They take you order ahead of time in line and then by the time we reached the cashier to pay everything was all ready.  I ordered a chicken baby burrito and a small strawberry agua fresca for myself and a especial carne asada burrito to go for hubby.  All this with free chips (for my dine in order and the to go) for under $17.  I'm so happy I got the baby burrito because I was getting so full.  The rice was orange rice with some peas and carrots in it, and had a light flavor.  The grilled chicken was moist and diced up.  A lot of times I try to refrain from chicken in my Mexican food due to fear of being dry, but this wasn't the case here.  I used some of the verde salsa in their squirt bottle.  The agua fresca was refreshing and not overly sweet or watery.  Chips were standard, didn't get diced salsa in it.    I don't get beans but I appreciate that you can choose which beans you'd like, what type of salsa, and what type of tortilla for your order as well.  My friend says she likes La Corneta because the meat isn't greasy and she doesn't feel like the food is so heavy here like she feels at El Farolito.  

There's a La Corneta by me in Burlingame, I'm hoping this chain is very consistent as I was impressed by my dinner here last week and would like to find a great Mexican restaurant in the Peninsula.  I always have fond memories of going to La Taqueria for lengua tacos with my uncle as a kid, hubs and I used to go to Taqueria Los Coyotes for California burritos, now I know another delicious taqueria in the Mission.  I really hope this area of Mission doesn't continue to get over gentrified!  Viva los burritos!
author: Cat C.

description:
Pro tip: I discovered that he super baby burritos are basically the same size as the regular burritos, but have guac and all the good stuff in them. They're of course a tiny bit cheaper which is nice (AND THEY HAVE GUAC). 

Every order comes with a side of chips (YAY), the chips weren't the best and were kind of greasy but they were free so I loved them with no discrimination. Salsas are available and you can get a quarter pint of guac for ~$4. The carne asada super baby burrito was good and this place doesn't usually have a queue so I would recommend if you're in the area :) Definitely had a food baby from that baby burrito
author: Hana S.

description: This place is SOO unorganized and MESSY. No one greeted us when we walked in so ordering was confusing. They had the line with all the food set up but no one was paying attention to us so we ended up paying for our order and the cashier didn't tell the workers to make our order because apparently you have to order then they begin preparing it AND then you pay for it and they bring it out to you. When we first walked in there were no available tables to sit at, every table had dirty plates etc don't bother coming here...
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Great, authentic Mexican joint with really quick service and loads of meat options. Super friendly staff. Burritos are a great size, and the super burritos come with chips and pico de gallo! Definitely get the bang for your buck.
author: Kevin N.

description: Ordered a super carnitas burrito. Pretty sure they just gave me a regular as I see no guacamole. Also no chips? The guy in front of me got the hookup. So disappointed - go to farolito or Cancun instead - subtle racism here indeed.
author: Shelby L.

description: I was looking for some not so greasy tacos and La Corneta met me expectations. I ordered three carne asada tacos, thinking they would be small. They use normal sized tortillas, double layers, and fully stuffed with meat. I was full after just one taco! The flavor of the meat was not as flavorful as I would have hoped but still a worthy taco. The chips and salsa are sooo great, would come back just for this. The venue itself has plenty of seating, looks clean, and has a somewhat authentic feel to it.
author: Daisy T.

description:
Simply stated, the best burrito I've had for a very, very long time. I got the prawn super burrito and managed to eat about half of it. Big, generous burrito, I would have brought a couple more things home but they were out of what I wanted, the tamales and the chile relleno so I just got the one thing along with some tasty guacamole and chips.

I wish I'd gotten one more thing but there was some confusion about where to place the order so there was some pressure to finish the transaction quickly by the time I got to the register and was informed the place to order was at the front of the counter. Oh well!

I look forward to being in the neighborhood again, I'll certainly make this my go-to and maybe order n the right place next time!
author: Sharon J.

description:
They have really good vegan burrito with vegetables and mushrooms.
The owner was really nice he came twice to check if the food is okay and if you need something else.
It's definitely became one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in San Francisco!!
author: Ido T.

description: Quite spacious. Service is quick. Free chips. Had quesadilla. Try the chocolate flan dessert.
author: B C.

description: Good fast Mexican food with many choices.  It is always busy so the food is fresh.   Live music on Fridays during lunch hours for a lively ambiance.
author: Mariaté G.

description:
It may have been because we were a party of 6 and ordering multiple pitchers of margaritas, but we got the all-star treatment at La Corneta and we would totally come back! In the area to visit a cousin, we wanted a taqueria we could all meet up at where we could easily grab a seat - this place was a great bet; we were able to waltz in, hold a table for six, wait 15 minutes for the rest of our party to show up, and then get table service from an incredibly friendly hostess who hooked it up fat with several baskets of chips, salsa, and a couple guac cups. Way to get it started!

The margaritas were super-drinkable if not insanely strong, and the chips and salsa are great (not spicy at all, but a very fresh pico de gallo). 

My bf and I shared the chicken enchilada plate ($8.70) and the steak & prawn super quesadilla ($11). The enchiladas are usually my go-to, but the quesadilla stole the show, big time. I could have done without the sour cream, and would go for the regular version in the future. 

If you're thinking of trying out the place, ditch the burrito menu and go for something unique. There's always El Farolito down the street if that's your mood, but I loved the classic taqueria vibe, seating, and service. 

We'll be back!
author: Laura B.

description: I was excited ordering but when I saw the girl preparing my burrito using her bare hands with no gloves, I got turned off.  Yikes!
author: Lilibeth D.

description: Live music and delicious fresh food on a Saturday afternoon. Can't get better than that! Also definitely get the horchata.
author: Andrea C.

description:
U roc
We roc back
U lov
We lov u back
D best
D lish
Spread words
Keep coming back
Heck yeh
author: Chef C.

description: This is one of my favorite taquerias on mission st. The prawn super taco is excellent. Ingredients taste fresh. The atmosphere is great. Live music today for lunch. If you are looking for a place to chill. This is it. They also have a full service bar.
author: Jen R.

description: Good Mexican food, but service can be blah the register girl seems so upset working there she has a straight face not friendly at all. Prawn tacos are really good and they have a bar area which is s big thumbs up. Love the Micheladas!
author: Vee N.

description: My tortilla had blue mold growing on it. I should of took a pic and posted it. I will not be coming back to this place.
author: Vick D.

description: Horrible food.. Better off walking down to 24th  and Mission to get a real burrito. Straight yuppie taqueria
author: Ernesto C.

description: We love this place. Friendly staff always. Always clean. Super fast even when the line is long and reasonably  priced and great food. They will customize whatever you want without a complaint. I always get the super baby burrito and try different meat each time.  Boyfriend try's different meal each time as well. Never go wrong with them. A+++
author: Angel C.

description: I love this restaurant! The selection is great and the service is top shelf. The servers are extremely friendly, pleasant, and eager to customize your order, even as they prep it. Due to my lifestyle, I always order take-out. This being my favorite eatery in the Bay Area, I order here 3 nights per week. I love the nachos, burritos, and the quesadillas especially. I highly recommend this restaurant whether dining alone or with a large group.
author: Billy J.

description: Meh. Good salsa verde, fresh salsa, adequate tacos but the rice is bland, and I have no idea why they use iceberg lettuce. They do have a liquor license & a nicer eating area than most area taquerias, which I think partly explains the popularity.
author: Hawley S.

description:
Everything here seems to be missing something. Whether it's the lack of salt in the guacamole, the lack of a legitimately spicy sauce in the "picante" super burrito, or the lack of ice in otherwise warm aguas frescas, it really seems like the place is half-a**ing things.

I actually saw one of the ladies here place a plate of chicken in the microwave to serve someone.

I guess gentrification isn't just affecting housing...
author: Sergio G.

description: Talk about massive portions! After hitting Delores park, we wanted some mission grub. I got the burrito hoping it would be close to el farlito but came up pretty short of expeditions. Had a couple of bites of my buddy's nachos. The place was pretty busy but the line moved along pretty quickly. Ambiance was nice because they had a live band playing.
author: Frank T.

description: Food is not bad. If your a vegetarian avoid it he rice. The girls are so slow at taking people's order! They need a better system.
author: Malik C.

description: I had a burrito with spicy chicken + guacamole. There was a depth of flavor that showed the quality of every ingredient. Great, friendly service. Came in hungry. Left full for $9.
author: Jasper P.

description: The ordering process takes awhile. Customizing your food doesn't help because in the end they still ask you what you want on your burrito. The steak is very bland/not flavorful. However the shrimp taste good. Pico de Gallo needs some work.
author: Ann L.

description: Big fan. Lots of seating, free chips, solid burritos, and creamy horchata. The fish burrito was not breaded fish, which is a nice distinction from most others in the mission.
author: Marcel M.

description: Got a super fish burrito. Delicious! The burrito is huge too! I could only eat half before feeling full. They have a green sauce and a red sauce in condiment bottles that you can take to your table. The green sauce is amazing! I couldn't really pinpoint what exactly it was, but I showered my burrito in it for sure. They do give tortilla chips as well. However, I wish they had a self-serve salsa bar life most taquerias have. They literally give you 2 salsas to choose from, mild or hot.
author: Lexi R.

description:
Used to go to El Farolito nearby, but they stopped having fish burritos and we discovered La Corneta. I loved the ambience of this taqueria, plenty of space, high ceiling, festive decor and they had mariachi band every time we were there.

Super baby fish burrito was my favorite - perfect portion and tasty! Choice of salmon or tilapia. Super baby size was just filling enough for me, with the "super" fillings (avocado etc.). I was hoping the tortilla could be more toasted, but it was great overall with complimentary chips.

We usually sit further away from the mariachi band, so that we could enjoy conversation with music in the background. Would certainly come back for another super baby fish burrito or other items on their huge menu!
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
The place is clean which is really nice and they have a large selection on the menu

But my friend waited to pay because they were busy chatting and laughing it up

They asked if I want spicy for my burrito and I said yes I'm not sure if they though in couldn't handle but it was mild as hell I love spicy red salsa and jalapeños I live for the heat

On top of that my burrito was barely warm I work in food and hot food holding temp is at least 135 so either it's at like 100 or they don't mix around the items or keep them covered so it's hot on the bottom cold on top

The bathroom was missing a soap dispenser so there was literally a plastic cup with soap in it........... because that's really sanitary
author: Terran C.

description: They accommodated our party of 32 with patience and panache. The food was very good. The ambience added to the quality of the experience. I particularly liked the mural of the Virgin of Guadalupe. Nicely done.
author: Jayne I.

description: The burrito here is so-so. We came since El Farolito was packed and had a long line. We were expecting more based on the high review from Yelp. They did mix a lot of varieties into it but it wasn't served hot and tasted quite bland. The customer service is alright, very casual with little attention to our needs when we ordered. The environment is nice nevertheless, with designs that are representative to the Mexican culture.
author: Eva H.

description: Been here several times but highly disappointed bad service couldn't get me order right 15 minutes to make 1 burrito had to make twice still got wrong I only asked for no guacamole.never asked what beans I wanted..not sure if I will ever return.....
author: Tierra L.

description:
Hadn't been here in over a year... had a taste for it... unfortunately I was a little disappointed with the service first of all.  People are not friendly or appreciative that we are here to pay for good food.  I understand the world we live in today is scary, but employees need to at least say "May I help you?" 
After we placed our order the biggest disappointment was the temperature of the food, it was really lukewarm.  Couldn't wait to take it home to reheat it... not sure if i'll take a bus across the bay to visit this once upon a great spot!
author: deborah s.

description: I was starving with my friends so we stopped by here. My stomach has never felt so full and satisfied. I had the vegetarian burrito and it is way better than any chipotle burrito you've had. They pack it up so so so much, I love it!
author: Kimberly M.

description: The food here is really good big portions good flavor but why the 1 stars because the females that work here suck! They look at you crazy when your ordering or if you dare to ask for salsa for my food and chips I guess there only nice to guys because the same beezy that helped me helped the guy behind me and was hella smiling being super nice. I go to pay for my food and ask again for salsa since they didn't give me nun she asked spicy? And I said yes please she grabbed the salsa from the bottom I got my stuff and left. When I was going to eat in my car they didn't give me any napkins forks or tortillas for my #3 plate what??? they always give you tortillas when you order a plate wtf? Gave me regular pico de gallo not the spicy one and only gave me one little salsa for a plate chips and 2 tacos. And to top it all off I had to eat my food with the damn chips man since these bitches couldn't even give me shit! I forgot all these items come out these beezys pockets! Honestly the females that work there need to get it together and stop acting like this shit coming out there pocket!! Guess all stick to El Farolito. Fuck y'all! *drops mic*
author: Erika E.

description: Honestly I've been going here for the past 4 years, I've never loved a taqueria as much as la cornets. They have good prices and very clean restaurant I live next to this place and I see them every night cleaning and cleaning the kitchen. I always recommend this place to anyone who want to try a taqueria
author: Ahmad I.

description: Jose is the best at setting up catering orders. He has been helping me with events at South of Market Child Care for years. His taco bars are plentiful and delivery is always set up professionally. Big crowd, great food, and nice people.
author: Dianne A.

description:
I had a carnitas baby super burrito and holy crap I think by baby they mean as big as a baby. Really delicious all the way around--probably one of my favorite burritos. Rice was also delicious!

My only critiques are the TVs are louder than I'd like and I saw three dogs inside the restaurant which was pretty gross (paws on tables and such).

Wheelchair accessibility notes: Flat entrance and a spacious dining area with movable chairs at normal height. Street parking only. Didn't use the bathroom.
author: Tricia R.

description:
Start with  the salsas... Probably the best charred tomato salsa we've ever had; the others are all fresh and distinctive.   Ceviche!   Fresh, fresh, fresh... Served on a nice thick, crispy tostada and topped with giant chunks of avocado. I wasn't very hungry, so had the ceviche and a quesadilla... Uh. $5... Crazy!   Tipped the great Trio (bongos and two guitars with a vocalist who brought back memories of old San Juan with his renditions salsa classics) as much as the cost of the meal.
Good service, great food, wonderful live music and low prices.   I'll be back!  Oh did I mention the musicians were there at lunch time?!
author: N Iola C.

description: So so yummy!!! I got the super vegetarian burrito without cheese so basically vegan!! And it was so delicious so yummy!!!! 5/5 stars yes!!!! So affordable $6.50 with guac so like half of the cost of chipotle. I am so happy
author: Audrey K.

description: I've eaten here more times than I can remember. Their guacamole salsa is so good. I pour it on everything. Free chips with salsa with orders and they ask you if you want hot or mild. I'm in love with their tacos al pastor, lengua burritos, mushroom quesadillas but their chile relleno looks battered just like my mom used to make so I'm keen to try that. They also have beer on draft along with bottled choices and the horchata is tops! Very spacious inside with awesome murals and decor. I feel like I'm in Guadalajara.
author: Sally M.

description:
ONLY TAKE CASH

This place is amazing. The food is authentic and absolutely delicious. The ambience is good for a go in eat and head out kind of place. The staff is incomparable. I say that because we stayed at this place for about 2 hours with one burrito and we were treated with the same courtesy throughout.
author: Aditya P.

description:
Not a bad place to get lunch. I have tried their buttitos, tacos, enchilladas, chile relleno, ceviche and several other main courses and I never left dissapointed. The let down is the dessert menu; the churros this restaurant has in the menu were not fresh at all (I nearly cheap one of my front tooth while biting a churro) and the alfajores' powder sugar tasted like the kind of flour my great granma used to use to cook before we asked her to stop cooking for us. I will be back but no way I will be having desserts here, unless they replace the current menu items with decent ones.

An advice for the owner, please go ahead and fire the person who makes desserts or send him to pastry 101 at some community college in Tijuana.
author: Sylvester C.

description:
We happen to be out and about and wanted to check out Mexican restaurants in the Mission district. We happen to stumble upon this restaurant. 
The restaurant ambiance was okay, but we couldn't really have a decent conversation inside; there was a loud live band inside- Mariachi playing.
The food was okay. We ordered tacos el pastor and super nachos. There was nothing extra special with the food.
author: Veronica D.

description:
This Taqueria in the Mission is actually clean, modern and welcoming!

I love the ambiance and layout of the whole place!  The decor on the wall illuminates an outdoor atmosphere while there is a flat screen TV hung up on the wall for everyone to watch the sports' channel.  It makes the whole restaurant look like an outdoor patio, while enjoying the actuality and perks of being able to dine inside!  

I was watching soccer that afternoon while munching on my scrumptious, generous portioned tacos!  That soccer game was pretty entertaining with Mexico scoring one point and winning the game, having David Beckham make an appearance in his soccer uniform and the camera caught the other team attempting to help this one guy from the Mexico team out because he basically fouled him pretty harshly and the guy slapped his hands away - gesturing him to lay off, I don't need your help! 

As for the meal, they provide pico de gallo salsa and chips with every order! I got their carne asada and chorizo tacos!  They surely pack the tacos with a whole lot of meat!  I love their chipotle salsa that they serve with the tacos.  That lightly roasted salsa compliments the tacos well and by adding the green salsa that they provide on the side table, it makes the whole meal just so saucy and gradually spicy!

If you're dining in, there are busboys that clean up after you.  Once you're done with the meal, you don't have to seek out where the trash bin is at to put your tray away!

Just $3 for each taco, having all those snazzy salsa flavors, great servers and amazing ambiance, this Taqueria is amazing!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Apparently this place is a great hit in the city and when we arrived, the place was busy and the line was practically to the door. The place itself is pretty small to begin with so maybe it seemed more crowded then it really was. Even though it is on the small side, there is still a seating area to enjoy your food if you choose to do so.

Their menu here is HUGE and I mean HUGE! Which is great for people who like options or annoying for people who get overwhelmed with some many options. The staff here didn't seem very organized while taking ordered and seemed rushed and forgetful. We both ordered some burritos, they are rather large and at decent prices. Again, heard good things about this place and expected to taste one good burrito. 

The burrito was good but it wasn't "like omg this place is the best ever", which to be honest, I was looking forward to. Overall the burrito was good and I would come here again if I am in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again. Lots of people here on a regular basis and is a hit - so check it out if you haven't already! Deserves a chance! 

Parking here sucks though! But then again it is a San Francisco!
author: Anne R.

description: This place reminds me of Pancho Villa Taqueria. The interior is spacious, nicely decorated, and they have a tall ceiling. There are plenty of seats. When you walk in, there is a steam table with a variety of meats which they serve you from.  The salsa that they offer is chunky and by default, non spicy. You have to request for the spicy option. In addition to the salsa they give you, they have the largest self serve salsa selection I have seen, with more than 6 options. I ordered the super burrito and it did not stand out at all.
author: James S.

description:
Terrible customer service- very rude and short or they just completely ignore you. 
They can never get any order right, I order 2 tacos and come home with 1. 
Horrible burritos. 
There are way better Taqueria's around. This is a last resort and if you're okay with being ripped off or not given your full order.
author: Mandy F.

description: I really go like it here. The food is always fresh. But the chicks serving the food need to pay better attention to the customer rather than gossiping with one another.......Chisme Chisme Chisme
author: Rita B.

description: This is my second event held here at La Corneta on 24th and Mission (first time was dinner this time was lunch) and the service has been excellent. The food was great and served the plate presentation was very nice, the set up was nice and prepped ahead of time with "reserved tabs" the staff was ready and attentive so everything arrived fast. The manager was regularly checking on us to make sure we were pleased and "hydrated"  I highly recommend the Sangria and the Mojitos the provided on the house. Overall experienced was excellent and I will continue to have my events here.
author: Libby D.

description: Delicious tacos, at a fair price, in huge portions. Paired with their margarita or any of the beers on tap, its a fantastic and affordable/filling meal. I appreciate the many vegetarian and vegan options-the tofu taco was very well seasoned and flavorful.
author: Amalia M.

description:
Best Chicken Salad in town :-) very healthy, delicious and enough amount for the price.
I come here once a week because I love this salad and the prices are good.
author: Patricia G.

description:
Well, i will have to come back to eat here, I did not have the ability to judge my food with a dog staring at my plate. I was too concern with the dog shedding hair, and flying on to my food.  

I must say the service was great, it was the dog that made my experience no bueno...
author: Greg V.

description: I used to come here all the time to get the super burrito for only $6 (its full of guacamole, and it big enough to make two meals!) What a deal that was! and I still love them a great deal but they raised the prices and now it's about the same as most taquerias in sf these days $9-10 per burrito.. not as much of a deal, but still good food.
author: Mia M.

description: The food is pretty good. carnitas is very good, not too dry. All other meat is good too but my favorite is the carnitas.  The workers are very friendly but I noticed they tightened up when the owner is a round. Fair price but it's cash only.
author: Peter L.

description: Got a Super Prawn Burrito and it was delicious. Would defiantly go back to this Location.
author: Rebecca Q.

description: Great and tasty food. Their green salsa is SO CREAMY its crazy. They also have a small bar area to get drink and occasionally they have live music playing. Great place to watch soccer or baseball games while getting tasty Mexican food. The only bad thing I can think of is the burritos are kind of smaller compared to the other Mission St. burritos, but the TASTE is there.
author: Miguel G.

description:
Came to La Corneta last night with a couple of friends for some quick Mexican food. 
Honestly we ended up eating here because we walked from one place to another throughout Mission and couldn't find another taqueria that took card.

The burrito and quesadillas were really good. The green and red sauces aren't spicy though. Service was not the friendliest but this isnt the kind of restaurant where you get served food at your table.

The ambience was nice, a lot more than you would expect from a hole in the wall mexican place for sure.

The three of us ordered separately but we only got one tiny basket of chips..hence the minus one star. 

I'd swing by for another burrito though.
author: Alba C.

description:
Great place and great prices! La Corneta Taqueria is kind of set up like a Chipotle where you order at the food bar, but the food is FAR from Chipotle. It is made fresh to order and very delicious! 

I came here with a friend for Cinco De Mayo, and the place was pretty busy. The line was to the door, but it definitely moves very quickly. I had a taco dinner which included enough meat for 2-3 tacos, tortilla, beans, rice, guac, lettuce, tomato, and a side of chips and salsa. All for $8! We also had margaritas ($6 each). They we very strong and delicious.
author: Gina P.

description:
In my opinion, this is the best Mexican restaurant in San Francisco for many reasons:  Scrumptious TASTE, BIG portions, FRESH CUT ingredients--sliced before your eyes. La Corneta is authentically old world fare--not trying to be hip (and then missing the mark).  La Corneta is my 'Go To' when I want great taste at reasonable prices. (There is even a GIANT hand painted mural of the Madonna in this big place of 3 rooms. Now if that isn't old school what is). 

I went there once and couldn't get it out of my mind, so I returned again. When I told the manager how much I appreciated his food, he got a wide grin, IMMEDIATELY left his cash register and personally escorted me to the table, bringing whatever I needed. Lastly, end the meal with a perfectly made churro treat (costing $1 dollar) to munch on the way home and compadres--you will have scratched that itch for a perfect Hispanic lunch in the Mission.  

PS - Another reviewer mentioned a noisy Mariacchi Band on an evening. I have NOT been for dinner, but simply check ahead and don't go if they are having a band that night. What can I say, La Corneta is the real deal. Get into it.  :)   Locale is around Mission at 23rd or 24th St.
author: Marianne F.

description: When every other taqueria has a line the size of a railroad, you can try La Corneta. This has a nice interior. It has enough space. It has a classic menu for Mexican food. Had a veggie burrito, soft shrimp taco, and strawberry juice. I would go here again and recommend this for a nice Mexican food experience on Mission.
author: Denise C.

description: This place is a legend in the mission the ingredients are always fresh and food is seasoned very well. They're also generous with chips and salsa I had my first Mexican Coke here 13 years ago and have been addicted to it.
author: N A.

description:
We were craving good Mexican food and stumbled into this place after passing a couple places that seemed less than desirable. We got the shrimp burrito and the combination #1 (chile relleño, enchilada and flauta.... I traded the flauta out for a taco with al pastor) the shrimp burrito was BOMB! I would recommend getting the taco platter instead of the combo, just because the tacos are SO GOOD!

All that food, 2 beers, plus chips and salsa was $30! No bad for really good Mexican food. 

The atmosphere is about a 2/3-- think Baja Fresh or el pollo loco setting... But no problem for a casual meal!
author: Holly M.

description:
My very first time that a friend brings me here
My burrito gets done my way... To end up going to someone else????? I let the cashier knows .. But she ignores me ... And after getting upset she realized her mistake...am not coming for second
author: salvador r.

description:
San Francisco is not known for their Taquerias, until now!

Being from San Jose the home of La Vics orange sauce, Chaleteco Chips/Salsa, and La Costa Burritos, I always have my doubts heading into any SF Taqueria but stumbled in here drunk after the Yelp Party as most places close at 9 this place was open till 10pm so I strolled by culo in here.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Pros:
- customer service (they bring the food to you)
- capacity/seating
- tvs
- bathrooms (super clean, i was truly amazed)

Cons:
-parking
-napkins
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Food:
Super Nachos - with steak, beans, lettuce, chopped tomatoes, guacamole,  and of course chips really good ($7)

Spicy Prawns Plate - beans, rice, salad,  tomato, and of course the prawns were damn good!!! ($9)

Super Tostada -  lettuce, tomatoes, guacamole, steak ($4)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

In conclusion: 
"La Corneta Taqueria Suavemente, besame que quiero sentir tus labios besandome otra vez, Suave!!!"
author: Deep S.

description:
I don't know why it took me so long to write my first review on this place, but the first negative experience unfortunately lead me to post on Yelp.  One rude chica got my order wrong from the first order to the second. First order I watched to see if much  order was no ng to be skimpped on with lack of sour cream and cheese. I go to this specific  location for the quality of the food when I'm at school or nearby in the mission. The chica put beef on both orders. I asked that she not put lettuce on order and confirmed I wanted chicken.  When the second order was done wrong yet again, she just dumped the beef in the garbage as if she was going to dump the whole burrito in the garbage, then attempts to correct the mistake.  I asked the rude chica" was I rude to you?" NO response to my question and instead said the order was fine. I guess the assistant  manager came over and offered to make the order her self. I told her thank you and left with my order done correctly. 

To be totally honest it saddened me because I made it clear that I come to this location frequently. I don't have all of my receipts to prove my frequent purchases,but I do go there often and felt my patronage was not appreciated.  Additionally,  I feel  I was disrespected for no reason. I shouldn't be going to this location and instead  head to Poncho Villa instead before school or in the area. In fact that's what I'm going to do from now on. (one bad apple has spoiled me ever going back. I don't think she even thought she was getting in trouble like she was part owner.)   Adios!

Order received at  super baby chicken  burrito with extra cheese and sour cream,  spicy  Pico de gallo, no lettuce

Time in restaurant 5:25pm
author: La-Rae A.

description: Food is really good but workers have attitude. Not friendly. I've been hete twice and had the same experience.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Their food and service is better here than their other locations. 

Super burrito is $9.30 after tax.

They also accept credit unlike the Diamond Heights location.
author: Julie L.

description:
Dude, so we were roaming down Mission looking for a place to watch the Falcons vs. Niners game and the owners waved us in to watch. Oh, they're good...

Standing and watching the game quickly turned into drinks in hand. The owner brought out complimentary chips and salsa along with a heaping plate of their super nachos, which escalated into rounds of shots for everyone. Then came the 89-yard interception from Bowman and all hell broke loose. More shots of patron and bullet accompanied our roaring cheers and the basket of chips and salsa magically replenished itself. They brought us another complimentary nibbler, which I can't recall what it was but do remember that it was delicious...

The food wasn't anything spectacular or worth telling yo homeboys/girls but the portions were generous and the service was exceptional. It's also quite spacious. Easily overlooked but will not disappoint...that is La Corneta Taqueria.
author: Kat C.

description:
Really good prawn tacos. 
Large menu, so lots of options to choose from. 
Big space in the back. Clean. 
Mariachi guy walking around for entertainment.
author: Maddie N.

description:
Prior to hitting up the hot local Yelp Elite party, I was starving and needed a quick bite.  The Mission is known for it's Mexican food, and there were several crazy high-rated places in the area.  La Corneta might not have been the most popular, but it was the closest so my girlfriend and I found our way in.

I ordered the chorizo super burrito which surprised me when it weighed in at almost $9.  That's more expensive than a Chipotle burrito!  It tasted alright but I was pretty shocked by the sticker price.  The chorizo itself was a little underseasoned for me too.

With so much competition in the area, I'm a little surprised that they haven't really upped their game to compete effectively.  Service was ok but not really extraordinary in any way.  I'll try their competition next time instead.

Food: 6/10

Service: 6/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description:
I learned a new Spanish word today.  It is 
"incompetente". My girlfriend (a Latina) and I love La Cornetta at Glen Park, but this one in the inner mission has total incompetence polished to an art form.
They REPEATEDLY kept getting our orders wrong and that was after waiting for awhile at our table.  I don't mean just once or twice, they just kept getting it wrong again and again. Finally my girlfriend told them to forget it in Spanish and to refund our money we had paid. They gave us half the amount we paid. We pointed to the amount on our receipt and they gave us s refund back onto the credit card.
We will never go to this one again and just stick with the one in Glen Park where we slways get fine service.
Also wanted to mention fot the benefit of SF Health Inspector's interest. The staff was throwing metal food tongs into the salsa bins handles and all. Then sticking their hands in the salsa to retrieve the tongs and I watched them do this repeatedly.
Avoid this one and patronize the one at Glen Park where they apparently have competent management.
author: Eddie Cecil C.

description:
"El Farolito" is the universal, spring-loaded response you get before you can even finish asking where you, (if you're like me) as visiting Brooklynite with Tex-Mex roots, should get a good burrito. Naturally, we ran to it out first day here but the line and the cramped space turned us off, so we migrated to La Corneta instead. The service was really good and the carnitas was too. Having since sampled the same at El Farolito, I'm led to speculate that the folks behind La Corneta are gunning for that spring-loaded response to good burrito recommendation requests because their's was waaaaay way way better. 

Better seating, better service, better burrito, same price, same location.
author: Brian B.

description: Terrible slow customer service. Waited 20 mins to put my order in. They cannot understand your order even though you are reading straight from their menu on the wall. The ceviche tostada I ordered was unable so they decided to charge me for a shrimp combo plate. The cashier guy did not even apologize for this major error. Will not be back. I do not recommend this place to anyone.
author: J C.

description: really great food and service! the manager gave us a free pitcher of margaritas it's was so nice and it was super delicious! definitely would recommend!
author: Presley P.

description: Some of the best Mexican food in SF, but the worst dirtiest bathrooms you've ever seen.
author: Jay M.

description: Was lining up here for lunch, all of a sudden 20 kids came in behind me n the line became long too.  This couple came towards me n noticed the line is long n wanna cut n sorta asked me if they could cut n go in front of me.  Okay, I was being nice n let them cut but don't go in front of me n i told them to go behind me if u wanna cut.  We sorta don't understand eachother.  WTF, Pisses me off when sometime being nice isn't the best thing to do then n that they don't feel appreciative.  When it was their turn to order, I told the workers that they cut me n cut the rest of the kids too.   The workers n the couples were speaking the same language, chatted a bit n still didn't do anything about the situation.   So the food was good however was treated unfairly too.
author: L. C.

description:
One of my favorite "go to" s in the Mission.  Especially when entertaining out-of-town guests.  I like that you can enjoy a sit down dinner with alcohol (if you are inclined).  While loud, they have spacious seating.
I loved my chile relent combo, while my friend thought his carnitas burritos a bit bland. I'd advise if you want it hot, say "picante!!"

I will be entertaining family from Nevada this weekend. This will be our destination.
author: hugh c.

description:
Huge portions of delicious reasonably priced food.  Their nachos are big enough for four people to share.  Parking is a pain, it's the reason for four stars instead of five, but this place has been a fave for years now. 
Try the ceviche!
author: Justin N.

description: I freaking loooove this place! They make the absolute BEST fish mojado burrito. I can't say enough about the tastiest burrito in the Mission. I have lived in San Francisco for over a decade and I honestly believe through and through that this place makes the tastiest concoctions of burritos. Whatever you're craving Mexican food-wise , this is definitely the place to go. They're always friendly and the tables and chairs are clean. You can take a tourist and they'll be pleasantly surprised. I've tried to resist writing about them because it's one of the best kept secrets and I don't want them overloaded with idiots clients like at EF. They hook up the chips too. They're perfectly light and crispy. I must give props where props are due. Thank you, thank you for making every experience so deliciously flavorful. You make me oh so happy.
author: Mei F.

description:
The best burritos I've ever had.  That 538 contest totally blew it.

We've been going since they opened, and then expanded.  I love seeing the same faces behind the counter; it says something about long-term employee satisfaction.
author: Barry K.

description:
If "Cheers" was set in the Mission instead of Boston, surely La Corneta Taqueria would be Norm Peterson's feeding frenzy of choice. It's like a South-of-the-Border version of the Hungry Heifer because the combination plates here could easily feed a small army of migrant workers. Surprisingly, I've actually never been here before since El Farolito and Taqueria Cancun are so close by and satisfy my discriminating taste buds. OK, they're not that discriminating since sometimes I just like quantity. Norm! 

It's a cavernous, brightly lit place just down the block from the 24th Street BART station. You just order upfront in front between the grill and the prep area. The overhead menu is positioned a little too far to the left to browse easily. It also doesn't help that the print is minuscule enough to make the experience akin to an appointment with an optometrist. Still, Jamie W. and I both saw the prawns and mushrooms sizzling on the grill and wanted what he was making. I went all Norm and went with the $12.55 Combination Plate of Carne Asada, Pollo and Prawns with Mushrooms. Oh yes, I did. 

It was more a flattened slice of pork, a large marinaded chicken thigh, and a lotta jumbo prawns, mushrooms, garlic, and green onions, all of it hot off the grill. On the other side of the plate was a big pile of warm black beans. Flanking all of this was rice, shredded lettuce a ladleful of guacamole and what looked to be a slice of the world's largest tomatoes (see photo). You also get a half-dozen tortillas wrapped in aluminum foil, as well as a basket of chips with fresh salsa, mild or hot (see photo). I get exhausted thinking about it, but it was truck-driver good, especially the tender chicken and the succulent prawns. 

For a dollar less, Jamie just had the $9.95 Garlic Prawns with Mushrooms (see photo). Note that we both got a basket of chips! Yes, it is a glutton's paradise in here, which may explain why the restroom is rather on the atrocious side. Watch for puddles. There's also this strangely hermetically sealed room with glass walls that we haven't quite figured out. Perhaps when I remember to bring my Playtex gloves, I should try to go in there myself. Needless to say, you'll be rolling out of there when you're done. Maybe everybody will know my name next time. See ya, Norm! 

FOOD - 4 stars...does abundance mean excess?...Stop judging me! 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...bright, colorful, spacious...and then there's the men's room 
SERVICE - 3 stars...they must be judged on speed, certainly not eye contact or friendliness...I don't think I ever finished a sentence at the counter 
TOTAL - 4 stars...if you're really hungry and just can't push the plate away, this is good, tasty stuff
author: Ed U.

description: Just got ripped off. Asked for extra meat on my 'meat and shrimp nachos got extra black beans instead.  Asked the waitress to complain, her and the cook straight up said there were two scoops of meat when it was obvious there wasn't.
author: Ricardo S.

description:
did i really eat an entire super shrimp burrito here?!!! - things that happen when i eat alone and there is no one to judge me

I'm also wondering why the hell it won't let me publish my review in all caps as it should be. Service is pretty slow and no salsa bar. They looked like I asked them for their first born when I asked if I could have an extra tablespoon of salsa for my chips.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Average food, not as tasty as other places. Tried the shrimps burrito, quesadilla and chile relleno, but wasn't impressed.  

The place has a lot of seats, so i guess one can always find a table where to sit.

The service was outrageous. I wanted to order my food and the women that are supposed to take the order were chatting/gossiping and ignoring me. Then they gave me a veggie burrito instead of the shrimps one. Then i reached the register to pay and the girl had such an attitude, like she was doing me a favor. There you go girl, you lost a customer!
author: Xavier R.

description:
I came here, because it was recommended to me and unfortunately it was not a good recommendation.

I ordered 2 carne asada taco with black beans on corn tortillas and it was seriously one of the most bland tacos I've ever had.

I can't eat raw onions, because they make me sick and so I couldn't eat their "onion and tomato salsa" that also comes with their chips.

In all honesty their "salsa" wasn't truly salsa, it was just chopped up onions and tomatoes with what seems to be tiny hints of cilantro. My question is what happened to the moist saucy authentic salsa that is found in most Mexican restaurants?

Anywho, I'm not sure what everyone else is raving about, but what I can tell you for sure is that I've had much much better. 

Sorry La Corneta, but it's a NO for me.
author: V W.

description:
Spending a Saturday in the Mission District, we decided on Mexican food for lunch so we hit up this place. It's large, the line moves quickly, and the menu is pretty varied. 

My partner ordered a burrito while I picked out the mushroom quesadillas. We took our seat and waited for our number to be called, which was only a few minutes.

Most quesadillas I've had are decent, I tend to get them as they're smaller than burritos and there's really nothing wrong with cheese, some veggies or maybe mushrooms. This quesadilla though definitely ranks up there as one of the best I've had. The mushrooms were great and full of flavour, just the right amount to cheese. The tortilla was grilled really well and the overall dish was delicious.

Definitely a place to check out if you're in the area.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Uber driver stated that this was best mexican food in town. Gave it a try. Was OK
author: Tim R.

description:
The place was good but I would say that it is in the average of the Taqueria in this city. Located in the mission, it probably uses employee that are newly arrived from Mexico since the two women at the counter didn't seem to understand much english at all. A good way to practice your spanish.

I had the "enchiladas special plate" which include choice of beans and filling. It was tasty. Orders comes with free chips and salsa but the "hot salsa" is not really spicy.
author: Stéphanie S.

description:
Pretty big, pretty authentic Mexican cuisine.

I wasn't too hungry so I asked for one super taco. Apparently no one ever does this because she assumed I meant two. Either way it was only ten, and the result was a slightly overly full christophe.

In the grand scheme of things this place is a four. Lots of seating and a lively clientele watching el fútbol on the mini overhead TVs. Of course I only call them mini because the astronomical growth in high quality TV screen diagonals over the past two decades.
author: Christophe C.

description: made an online order and was not impressed with 2/3 burritos we purchased.  i ordered a plain bean cheese rice burrito and i was given a burrito with peas and corn? the chile relleno burrito we ordered was also not good. i wouldnt recommend ordering from here online. however, the sheer size of the burritos we got was pretty awesome
author: Button L.

description: First timer and ain't coming back!!  I work in the area and my boss is always recommending this place to her costumers and she has A LOT,  I had never been there till yesterday. ... terrible costumer service,  my bad,  they doesn't know  what costumer service is!! do the owners care about it??
