The ladies have a huge attitude, they should smile more or if they're not happy with their job please quit,  we want to feel welcomed and feel like our business matter,  you guys ain't making us a favor, your there for to provide a service,  you giving me attitude? Ain't taking it,  attitude back to you miss,  I feel so embarrassed for all the costumers we had refer to this place LO SIENTO!! btw the rice is one of the worst I had ever had in the city smh I love all the art wall and the great eye candy but that's all,  please owners let your staff know smiling is free and does more good than having an attitude,  costumer service is a HUGE deal for all business but you ain't getting mine.
author: Ana G.

description: I went here for my birthday and they hooked me up with a free beer as I was serenaded by a mariachi who stops by (I paid for the mariachi but the beers were free).
author: Carlos A.

description:
Nice atmosphere for a taqueria: blasting music while playing futbol on the flat screens, the smell of grilled meats looming in the air, a sky light that opens up the space and plenty of napkins to soak up the hot sauce dripping from your lips. 

I tried this place out after having gone without food for over 20 hours. So my review may be skewed...

I got the al pastor burrito especial. It was a fine buritto, but I've had better al pastor from East Bay (closer) taquerias. However, everything else was on point. I'd come back for a chill lunch/brunch if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Jacky C.

description: This restaurant is the most one I have went to in my entire life, they always have NFL games on and so as most important soccer matches on, they have the best quasadillas I have ever had and I still go there nearly 3 times a week and have me dinner and watch a game there.
author: Ibrahim M.

description: Upgrade, new ownership, Awwwwwwwsome!  Shrimp  & steak  burrito  off the charts! The super shrimp & steak quesadilla is next. What I really like is the cook is close & visible. Also health department  was  present  at the table  next to me writing their report. From the conversation  between  dept of health, all was good except a few minor house keeping items. Very good  food  indeed
author: Ron P.

description:
Good thing about this restaurant is it can hold many people as it's so big.
Salmon plate was very good but I didn't like their salsa much. It tasted old and not so fresh:(
author: Maitai N.

description:
It's all perspective.

Could it be the horrible customer service? the reason the food is missing an appealing quality or the reason the place lacks a welcoming feel. 

I can't say, but maybe underneath the thick make-up & pomp, the servers are really creatures with no idea in how to interact with humans. Next time I visit, I'll try offering them sugar water.

Food is ok, but better places in the Mission for tasty eats and better service.
author: Darth M.

description:
Had lunch with friends here the other day and it appears to have changed....somewhat.

Almost half the tables in the joint were dirty/had leftover food sitting on them.  They stayed this way for at least 20 minutes.  Beers weren't very cold and food was just okay.

Either the busboy was slacking, or the place is understaffed but either way, it always looks bad to have so many dirty tables in a joint, especially during non peak dining hours.

I don't remember the plastic flatware and think that shit best for picnics, not a quick serve establishment.

With all the terrific Mexican joints in this hood, I won't be in any hurry to come back here.

Orale guey.
author: Anthony D.

description: We devoured that carne asada burrito before we could even take a picture. Lots of seating, the chips and salsa were tasty, and the price is right. We will be back.
author: KimnCris K.

description:
I've been on a quest to find a taqueria in the Mission that beats El Farolito. La Corneta has always piqued my interest with its clean and spacious ambiance decorated with red tiled floors and a colorful blend of red, orange, yellow, and other vibrant colors to bring a festive vibe. It's a bit smoky at the entrance where they broil and grill their meat to bring you an instantaneous aromatic introduction. This is also where you get to glance at the huge wall menu with a long food counter with all sorts of eye-popping meat, rice, beans and all the Mexican goodies you can imagine.

I've been to here twice, once for dinner on a weeknight another on a festive weekend that had a celebratory mariachi band where the place was bursting with people from all walks of life. On my first visit my super vegetarian burrito ($5.25) came with complimentary chips, black beans, rice, cheese, guacamole, lettuce, tomato and salsa. I wasn't too impressed with their burrito as it was dry on the spots that were without guacamole. I thought it had too much fresh lettuce and the salsa was bland. It wasn't the most flavorful and the experience was over-dependent on the red and green salsa located at each table.

My second visit I ordered a chicken tamal and pork tamal with rice, black beans, lettuce, guacamole, and salsa ($7.75). The chicken tamal was dry and bland but the pork tamal was tasty with tender fat trimmings to keep me engaged the whole time. I thought the rice and beans were decent but the complimentary chips could be better warmed and salted. Salsa again could and should include chopped jalapeno to induce a spicy kick instead of letting it fell flat. My order of large melon aqua fresca ($2.50) was refreshing and a nice finisher. I did not receive my stack of tortillas even though it was clearly stated on the menu. 

Overall, I thought their prices were higher than others in the Mission while in exchange the food had very good portions but the flavor was not exciting enough to match its beautiful decor. I saw many Mexican customers ordering their carne asada so that might be a dish to look into for those interested. This place is spacious and has the room to support large groups and families. 3 stars for the overall experience.
author: Daniel L.

description: Went here the other day with some of my girlfriends and I believe the manager came up to us and asked us if we wanted to sit instead of waiting in the long line, allowed us to sit anywhere in the restaurant. The food was delicious and the. Customer was top notch, we tried to split the bill so each of us could pay for our own food but they accidentally charged one of my friends for the full amount, we asked if they could fix it and instead they refunded her the full check amount in cash and they told us we could just go and not to worry about it! Definitely coming here again next time in in the city!
author: Diego D.

description:
Being extremely familiar with the glen park location, Mel and I decided to come here since El Farolito didn't accept cards.

I always get the prawn quesadilla whenever I come to La Corneta and it never disappoints.  The prawns were really juicy, the tortilla was grilled to a perfect crisp, and paired with chips/guacamole the meal overall fills you up well!  We were very satisfied.

The manager came out to greet us and ask how the food was; he even brought us some extra chips, salsa, guacamole, and beans too!  

So for a rather large prawn quesadilla, a side salad, bottomless chips, some guacamole, a coke, and spicy salsa I only spent about ten dollars.  This place is well worth your buck and there is about 2x the seating compared to glen park's location.
author: Jorel C.

description:
We were having a party for 30 and wants to do a taco bar... La Corneta had the best pricing and the manager was super nice, so we went ahead with them. Food was fantastic, had a great spread of chicken, carnitas, and carne asada with all the toppings you could want (3-4 different kinds of salsa, sour cream, guac). Guests loved it. Perfect for birthdays and super bowl parties. When I ordered the food, had to go pick it up on bust Mission St and they ran the food out to the car and packed it without me having to find parking. Very helpful.

I only give them 4 stars because they forgot to include the tortillas. Lol. So I had to do an emergency tortilla run to Safeway when the party started, which was less than ideal.
author: Carrie B.

description:
This is NOT a great spot, in an area where there is a glut of great Mexican food. The only reason to go here is because the line won't be too long. And because they have a bar.

If you're just visiting, don't blow your load on La Corneta.
author: Marcus C.

description:
NYC learning

The most important thing we made sure to learn when in NYC was to scout out and locate all the large bookstores in Manhattan.  Borders.  Barnes & Noble. Strand.  These are best to bookmark in the iPhone for directions.  Why?

Bathrooms, of course.  This was the most important I learned when walking around like the tourist trying very hard NOT to look like a tourist.  This was affirmed when someone stopped us on the street and asked us for directions.  

La Corneta is a clean and colorful spank version of my old fave, El Farolito.  The only reason why I stepped in was to utilize their restrooms and since I feel like such a heel for a cheesy utilization, I asked the fellow to purchase a Super Burrito Al Pastor.  This was on top of my 3/4 leftover Super Burrito from El Farolito down the block and here are the results after I took my take-out home and sliced the foiled bullet in half:

Cons:
1.  Burrito was half the size I'm usually accustomed to.
2.  Amount of the dry coarse bland meat was less than a ladle full.
3.  Peas and square carrots dotted throughout the burrito.
4.  Burrito was $3 more than what I usually spend.

Pros:
1.  The chips are very good.
2.  Burrito was tightly wound, like a torpedo.
3.  Clean restrooms, clean dining area
4.  Higher prices = cleaner and nicer dining experience.

I'm still a fan of El Farolito and Pancho Villa, but do appreciatethe modern take on the conveyor belt Taqueria assembly line here at La Corneta.  A clean and colorful counter delivered a mediocre burrito.
author: Miika M.

description: Rushed service. Ceviche was sad and dry. The cashier never looked up when she charged us. waaa waa waa
author: Audrey I.

description: Was looking for good mexican food in the mission and just bumped into this placed. Giving this little dine in restaurant 5 stars because the super prawn burrito was the highlight of my day!
author: Ashley B.

description:
This place is like a fast-burrito food joint. You order your dish, they make it with pre-made ingredients at the counter, go down the line and boom, you end up with a luke warm burrito that doesn't sing with flavor. Ordered the typical chicken super baby burrito and it was lifeless. While I was eating it, my mind drifted to wondering how much happier I would have been if I had one of the bacon wrapped hot dog just selling outside on the sidewalk a block away. Their chips were a little thick for my liking and their fresh tomato salsa didn't look so fresh (I assumed so because the tomatoes used were very pale).

Then I also had a major accident with one of their bottled salsa. It was so chunky that the tomato was stuck at the spout and when I squeezed a little harder, half a bottle of the salsa blasted on my boyfriend who was sitting next to me. I know when sometimes food get messy and everywhere, it means it's loaded with deliciousness, but this wasn't what I had pictured in mind.

(+1 for having a big place with many seating)
author: Elaine Y.

description: Best burritos in San Francisco. Incredible menu, excellent choices of aguas frescas. It's a place to eat well for cheap. Beautiful murals on the walls as well.
author: Justin M.

description:
Whenever I feel like having an amazing asada and shrimp burrito I stop by this place.
The meat is so tender and the flames just make it right I always have them add a little bit of garlic to my shrimp then I end up wanting to make love to the burrito instead of eating it.
Sometime they have live music playing nothing crazy just a three man band.
author: Josué P.

description:
la corneta is the best!
the food is always excellent and the atmosphere is vibrant.
i love the crispy tacos and my wife always gets a super veggie burrito with black beans.
the nachos are also another family favorite.
if you like aguas frescas then you should definitely order an horchatta grande.
so good and always fresh and clean.
my personal favorite in the mission.
author: Austin L.

description: It was busy when we went and the workers were still friendly, pleasant and service was quick and my burrito de al pastor was delish
author: Andrea S.

description:
Cool place, kind of reminded me of an island. 

I ordered the chile relleno plate; it came with black beans, rice, tortillas, and lettuce. The chile was not very spicy and the cheese and sauce were different than what I'm used to, but it was still very tasty. The rice and beans were delicious and so were the chips and salsa. 
They have a really great menu and a lot of drink options. The live music is a nice touch. No lines, plenty of space to sit. Will be coming back here soon hopefully!
author: Idk A.

description:
I really do miss this place. I don't work in the city anymore so coming here for lunch is out of the question. I used to take BART from downtown just for some good Mexican food. There's always live music playing here and it's packed with locals during lunch. Their nachos are huge and fully loaded with ingredients. I always ask for extra jalapenos. Their steak burritos are also very filling and you're not going to finish it all by yourself.

One great thing about the location is the fact that it's the Mission and it's usually sunny when it's cloudy everywhere else.

Did you know they have another restaurant near the Glen Park Bart station? That's the closest one that I go to when I want my fix these days.
author: Tim G.

description: This place has the best steak and prawn burrito, hands down. When you're looking to get away from El Farolito's tiny restaurant and the huge line, head down Mission to La Corneta to sit down and enjoy that burrito.
author: Marjo M.

description:
3 stars, it's cheap, good portions, and the salsa is good.  Chips aren't great but the guacamole was tasty.

The service for our experience was tragically bad though, asked question about tacos and got an antagonistic confused answer.  Simply asked if I could get a super taco with no sour cream and one crispy taco and one flour.  Prepped as two crispy one with sour cream, asked for again no sour cream where it was simply grabbed off the top... Then gf says no sour cream, it gets it again, asked for no again with same result.
author: Leland T.

description:
Usually this place rocks but seems lately its going downhill a bit, I love their baby super burrito and generally there is huge chunks of breast meat and wonderful portions of everything else. Staff friendliness is usually so so however

Today, january 13,tuesday- I ordered a super burrito with hopes of eating it twice. I dont know who the guy was serving this but he was pretty apathetic and really short changed me in portions and not even including what was supposed to be there and what I paid for. 

The burrito was almost nothing but beans and rice, no avocado, no sour cream, no cheese and very very little chicken. Even the salsa containers were less than half full. The next time I go in I guess the children will need supervision.
author: Michael S.

description:
This taqueria is HUGE (and extra points for being clean). It'd be a good place for groups. They have a lot of tables and plenty of seating. The menu is just as large as the place itself! I finally narrowed my order down to the carne asada nachos. 

I was excited for a big plate of chips covered in everything imaginable.  When they set it down in front of me i was impressed by the big portion.  The first several bites were great but it quickly got SOGGY. Their chips are great - light and crunchy. They're also too prone to soaking and my nachos were no longer appetizing to me when it became mush.  Black bean, guac, sour cream, chippy mush :( My friends tamales looks amazing though and i think they deserve 3 stars for what probably could have been a great meal if i had ordered something else.

A mariachi band came in at the end of our meal and set up camp right next to my table. My hapa friend and i bursted out laughing when they started singing "little chinitas"! Really? Are you singing to us? Because i'm pretty sure we were the only asian + half asian diners there. Slightly embarrassed and no longer able to hear each other speak over the music and singing, we left. Hilarious.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Last time I was in San Francisco, I ended up in the Mission district and with a ridiculous craving for tacos - turns out we were in the right spot for that feeling because there were seriously so many places to turn to! Naturally, we opened up the Yelp app so we could crowd source our final decision and - voila - we would up at La Corneta Taqueria! 

From the moment you enter the door, the wafting smell of spices and meats will hit you like the tastiest brick ever - and make it impossible to decide what to eat, lol.  As we slid down the single file line, we were greeted by four lovely ladies who kept things moving at an incredibly fast pace.  I went with a boat load of tacos - a few carnita, carne asada and last but not least some al pastor. Needless to say, I was stuffed!  To boot, their guac was AMAZE.  I'll definitely be coming back here but on a completely empty stomach so I can try'em all =D
author: Amanda G.

description: Walked in and asked about something on the menu. Well, I asked but got ignored and then treated really abruptly. There was nobody waiting in line for the women I spoke to. They were rude. I went around the corner, spent a bunch on a meal and tipped generously. Sorry!
author: Emil W.

description: Excellent, huge burritos. Skip the free tortilla chips though. Tasted store-bought. Guacamole was pale and tasteless.
author: Jedidiah G.

description: great Mexican food no1 in my book fast service it would be great if they spoke a little engles
author: Taliah S.

description:
Yes please.  I don't care much for the mission district, I like cleaner streets and more sterile feel but it's definitely worth coming to for the food... 

Good food when you just want to fill your inner mexican cravings.  It's not much of a place you go for ambiance or for service, but it gets it done.   

Had a super taco and a fish taco.. too much.  

Next time I'll just get a super carnitas taco and get birite icecream.  

Btw, cash only.
author: Hannah W.

description:
Whenever I come to SF, I always make sure I stop by one of those great Mexican taquerias, something we don't really find in France. 

I asked one of my friends, Karina K., a fellow Yelper who lived in SF for years, and she recommended La Corneta. I have to say I wasn't disappointed at all. 

The place is pretty big so you should find plenty of space for your lunch. You can either order from the counter for takeaways or sit down and wait for the friendly waitress to take your order. They will then offer you a small glass of sangria as a starter, with the usual guacamole and salsa. 

I was slightly afraid of the size of the real burritos for a light lunch so I went for the baby burrito. It was delicious and already huge so I'm glad I went for that. 
My friend had chicken quesadillas, which were also really good. On the top of that, there was a group of musicians playing traditional Mexican music. 

The only downside : the cleanliness. When I went in the restrooms, they were really dirty, probably because of dirty customers to start with, but not only. The tables themselves were not 100% clean either. Maybe I went there on the wrong day. This is too bad as everything else was really nice.
author: Laetitia L.

description:
this has is one off my favorite places in San Francisco ca. great food ,wonderful drinks ,
Excellent service .  try there salmon tacos ,there sangria ,yes to mention few things, everything it's amazing.
author: Maria S.

description:
A friend of a friend highly recommended this place for  the food and music.   We went and we had the number one combination  platter.  The music was great ! It is nice that they have a bar  because if you just want to go for the great music than you can.

That is what we will do next time we are out just for great music.
author: Keith K.

description: The worst customer service. Was waiting to order for 10 mins the women working there didn't even acknowledge my mother and I. I complained  to a "manager" who didn't even apologize instead made an excuse for them taking long. I do not recommend this place. This place does not even deserve one star!!!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Chocoflan! Chocoflan! Chocoflan. If you never had chocoflan, you don't know the meaning of life. Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp burrito and chocoflan from my favorite taqueria.
author: Azizah A.

description:
We had our company event catered by La Corneta and believe me it was as good as it gets.

I consulted with Joel and Joel Jr. to let them know what I wanted in regards to food, drinks and pricing.  They came up with the quote and delivered as promised.

Miguel came through with the food and demostrated hospitality and customer service to the tee.  The food arrived hot and everything was a success with our invitees.

This place is great and so are the employees
author: Isis L.

description:
solid carne asada burritos with larger than life sizes. i killed half of it and was in food coma for 2 hrs.  Great open space seating, cafeteria style ordering. quick service with a smile.
4/5 judochops
author: Dustin G.

description:
Mostly inexpensive depending what you get--- food was okay, not as spicy as you would think ordering a chicken dish meant to be spicy.  Decent enough selection of beverages, but I am sure that there are plenty of other restaurants nearby that offer similar if not better cuisine.  
The only plus was a Mariachi band for atmosphere and telenovela in the background.  Generally like to give restaurants a second chance and this is worth a second look.  Plenty of room for seating so welcome to bring as many people as you like!
author: John P.

description:
I am pretty damn impressed. 

I'm a picky mission-burrito-eater. I like a very specific kind of burrito at the right price, and La Corneta delivers. I'm traditionally a La Cumbre fan (c'mon, the original), but if I'm ever at the "far end' of the mission by 24th, this has become my go to. 

I got the Super Veggie Burrito which was more than enough for dinner, and then lunch again the next day. Hefty, flavorful, well constructed. They offer "baby burritos" for you meat eaters that don't want a huge honking burrito, which is a refreshing option to see. It doesn't really make sense for veg-folk though, because the super is essentially the same price. Weird how it works out, but I'm not one to turn down leftovers. 

As with seemingly all taquerias in the mission, the chips are made out of tasteless cardboard, but I'm perfectly happy with the burrito stealing the show. 

The cheese quesadilla is also a surprisingly good deal. Something like 1.80 for a corn quesadilla with a little side salad. I like having cheap more snack like options for when my friends want a burrito but my stomach can't quite commit to that. 

mmmm, now I want a burrito...
author: Claire G.

description:
Giant quesadillas - get the super prawn and steak quesadilla, the shrimp are so fresh! They also give you complimentary chips guac and salsa while you wait. The owner/manager here is so sweet! She gave us extra because our order got mixed up.

But the thing I really love about La Corneta is their secret beef soup. Perfect hangover food, and kind of the closest you can get to pho around here anyway.
author: Jess C.

description:
I haven't been to LaCorneta Taqueria in a longtime (2001). Back then,parking was a hassle in the Mission District. Since I am an employee of the city and county, I can park wherever I want. haha!!

Back then I used to come here every other weekend for a good burrito. And yes,today in 2006,they haven't lost a touch. 

I saw a fresh batch of rice and Tofu-verde going into the steamer by the cute female staff. You know what kind of Super-burrito I'm getting. My colleague ordered the Chili-verde super-burrito. We exchanged halves and both the burritos are equally delicious,considerring I'm a non-vegan.

I need to comeback to LaCorneta. And yes,since I haven't been here in awhile,they took me back.
author: Matt G.

description: The best taqueria I've ever been to. The ceviche is bomb, the burritos are huge...you really get your money's worth.
author: Madeleine L.

description:
So I'll start with this is not my favorite - but I end up going here more b/c its my husband's favorite. Its delicious, less greasy and CLEAN!! So clean relative to its taqueria cousins. I love going to el farolito, but feel a little gross going there during daylight hours, hence I frequent la corneta. 

Everything here is great - but i normally stick to a baby super burrito. Its the perfect size for me since I always end up wasting/saving/sharing a normal sized burrito. Thank you for this size!
author: Komal B.

description:
Not just another cafeteria-style taqueria in the Mission!

Food = 4.0:  There are tons of taquerias in the Mission.  I am suspicious of how sanitary these kitchens are but La Corneta is different. It's almost clinical looking!  You walk in, order from one of the ladies and watch your food being made.  The kitchen is orderly, tidy and efficient. The results are always delicious and the portions are huge!  My baby super burrito wasn't so baby!

Service = 4.0:  The staff works FAST!  The longest time between the moment I ordered and the moment I took my first oh-so-satisfying bite was probably 10 minutes!  Chips are free here, too.  There are some taquerias in SF that charge extra for chips.  That's as ridiculous as charging for rice at Chinese restaurants!

Atmosphere = 4.0:  Did I mention clean?
author: Eddie L.

description: Excellent food, excellent service.  They accommodated a party of 35 people during the day (on a Saturday, no less) with no problems.  Free music on the weekends.  I love dining here!
author: Lilliana S.

description: Don't waste your time eating here. Glen Park location is MUCH better. Glen Park food tastes much better, they give you generous amounts, they don't carelessly cram your to go order into too small of a bag and cause a mess and smashed burritos, their salsa tastes fresh, I could go on. The mission location sucks. Very disappointed.
author: Jessica E.

description: Goddamn that was a huge taco! And the spicy pico and strawberry agua fresca were delicious.
author: Emilie C.

description: Super Burrito with verde chicken ordered as "spicy". Delicious, possibly the best burrito that I've ever eaten :-D. Restaurant is very clean & nicely decorated inside. Feels very welcoming.
author: David C.

description: This is my favorite burrito place. I always get the Especial Burrito; chicken, refried beans, red sauce. I like how big and clean this place is. The staff is really friendly and fast. Proud to be the duke!
author: Chase L.

description:
This is a great spot in an area where there is a glut of great Mexican food. The food is solid, flavorful and yummy, and best of all, consistently so.  Whenever I leave, I always say to myself, I should go there more often. Always leaving satisfied is a good sign. Some other perks are the space and set-up. They have a quicker and more efficient ordering system than their usually more crowded local competitors. And the space; it's huge! You can really relax and not feel as cramped as you would at other places. I don't mind rubbing shoulders with folks for a good meal, but it is nice to relax at your own table and have your own space like you do at La Corneta. Space is key with a baby too. 

When the mariachis play, they can actually move around with their guitars and not bump into people. Makes for a relaxed and enjoying meal. 

They have great seafood options here, try the ceviche!
author: Gunter M.

description:
my bf and i were actually going to go eat at El Farolito for the first time and walked past this well lighted and clean Mexican restaurant and told ourselves, lets try it next time! El farolito wasn't as good as i expected from all the reviews. anyhow, the next week we went to eat at La Corneta and the quesadilla and burritos are to die for! 

CLEAN, FRESH and FRIENDLY! its so clean and very family oriented which is a plus for people who want to eat in big groups.

i ordered the regular grill chicken quesadilla STUFFED high with salsa, grill meat, and cheese. about 80 cents more you can have the SUPER which includes meat, cheese, salsa, guad, sour cream & lettuce! 

any mexican place offers free chips and salsa = I'M THERE
author: Carol Y.

description:
If your in the "mish" aka "The Mission" I believe that this spot is the old reliable joint for seafood, prawns, carnitas, pollo asado you get the picture. 

These  guys do it right every time. Fast, good service and it comes at a reasonable price.
author: Joseph M.

description:
Spicy Chicken
Spicy Beef
Spicy Salsa

Place is so legitimate, great cheap taqueria and I will be back.  Just love finds like this.  For a taqueria, I was also very impressed with the staff - very friendly.
author: Greg G.

description: Great food, great prices, great experience. Thank you staff and management for making our party's birthday boy feel special. Excellent customer service!! Definitely coming back again =)
author: Noelle S.

description:
Best Mexican food I've ever had in my life.

And I live in SoCal.
author: Jake H.

description:
We had La Corneta cater an office party today and it was a hit! The party was too but you probably don't care as much about that part. 

I definitely recommend the food here; the carnitas were delicious! Everyone that we worked with were super friendly and helpful and they were willing to work around all of our needs. We had a taco bar set up with chicken, carnitas, rice, beans, and toppings. Everyone couldn't stop asking where the food was from! A couple people in the office actually eat regularly at their Glen Park location, but we kind of chose blindly when we decided to use them. Normally we don't do such large parties in the office (20-25) people. But if we do, I would definitely use them again. Also, they will make sure you have enough food because this was a definite concern of ours. We had plenty of leftovers.
author: Stacy P.

description: Despite advertising vegetarian options explicitly on their menu, the burritos are not vegetarian. The person taking our order was incredibly rude and also told us the rice was not made with chicken. After taking a few bites, we went back and asked a manager, who confirmed the rice actually is made with chicken. If you are looking for vegetarian, definitely avoid.
author: Jeffrey D.

description:
A Clean Well Lighted Place for an evening meeting in the Mission, with quiet atmo, big tables to spread out on if you're working on a project, decent food. 

I always get perturbed b/c if I want a fish taco, I want it Baja style, with crispy fried fish not broiled salmon as they serve up at La Corneta.

They will leave you unmolested for hours if you are holding an inner circle braintrust meeting, as we were last night. Right on.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I have not been here for years and surprised I have not yelped this place. I finally came by this weekend and was able to eat here again. 

I love their Super Prawn burrito or their Garlic Prawns..YUMMY!! I like to get away from the usual chicken or pork. This past weekend, I split the super prawn burrito with my friend and got the nachos to share and got 2 al frescas (strawberry & cantaloupe). Nachos were ok..great to share. The al frescas were flavorful. 

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant, but I am not a connoisseur of Mexican food, but I do like the food here..=)
author: James L.

description:
Meh - it's a taqueria in the Mission. There is much better Mexican & much better taqueria food within blocks. This one messed up my order (added rice when I said no rice) and had stale chips. I'm giving one extra star for the TV's, not the food.

Actually, I changed my mind. They're only playing Mexican stations, which I normally don't mind. But during March Madness, soccer, really? I would have given two stars if it was a sleazy telenovela, but soccer right now is just American blasphemy.

Oh, and you guys might want to change your salsa more than once a week.
author: Richard B.

description:
They are my go to spot for vegetarian nachos in the Mission.  The refried beans are creamy and the cheese is perfectly melty.  The pickled jalapeños taste somewhat fresher than the usual ones fished out of a vat.  Their guacamole is fresh and not too loaded with onions (a deciding factor for me as I hate onions).  

I withheld a star for a few reasons.  

1. The giant menu on the wall behind the food station is very unclear, at least about the nachos.  There is regular which is vegetarian- chips, beans, cheese and salsa.  You can add meat to the regular.   Then there's super nachos which have everything and the kitchen sink on them.  Then, there's the mysterious "Vegetarian" nachos.  That's all it says.  I really only want two additional things than what is on the regular BUT I definitely don't want all that's on the super.  So I never know exactly how to order.

2. The staff can be a bit surly.  Well, mainly these two ladies that are always there the other people seem fine.  The more surly one reminds me of Carla from Cheers but Mexican.  She's smart as a whip and always gets the order right albeit with a stern expression.

3. I cannot stand those mariachis that play with amplified instruments.  There are lots of tables and it's a big place but you can't escape them.  You can barely enjoy your food or hear yourself think.  I only complain because there are no posted hours or dates and times listed when they are there.  I'm sure they are delightful to some but I want to just avoid them.
author: Lee M.

description: Management really made sure I ENJOYE my first time here. The portions are great, the options are versatile, and everything tastes great. Got bottled water and sangria tablesisde, on behalf of the management. They were muy excellente! I will be back without a doubt !
author: Jamila C.

description:
For the following reasons this place has become my favorite place to eat in SF.
1) COSTUMER SERVICE is great
2) various menu options
3) CLEAN
4)TV
5)CHEAP, I usually get a taco with chips and salsa with a small agua fresca for $5.11
author: Eryckah G.

description:
To remedy your mediocre La Corneta taco experience, just do the following:

1)  Walk out of La Corneta.
2)  Turn left.
3)  Walk half a block.
4)  Enter El Farolito.
5)  Order anything!

(You're welcome!)  ;)
author: Amy C.

description:
Good chips - thin and greasy.

As you can tell I'm not really a burrito person. The carne asada burrito was decent.
author: Gee H.

description:
In an effort to branch out of our usual burrito routine, we tried this on the recommendation of a lifelong Mission resident.  The experience was mixed, but I think it has potential, so we will definitely be giving it another shot.

The bad: the burritos were cold.  Very cold.  I know that having guac/lettuce/sour cream affects this, but I get that at other taquerias and yet the burritos wind up warm.  The young woman who made our burritos overfilled them, to the point where she couldn't wrap them like burritos before folding them in foil.  She just pinched the sides together like tacos and wrapped them in foil. It looked like she had never made a burrito before and I had to remake them when we got home so that we could actually eat them like burritos instead of rice plates.

The good:  the ingredients were great!  The rice was cooked well, the beans seasoned, the salsa (we got the hot stuff) inside the burrito was delicious and spicy.  Loved the chips, too.

We went on a Sunday night, fairly late, which is probably not when the best burrito-crafters are working. For that reason, we will stop by again, hopefully on a weekday, when the ingredients are warm and someone else is making the burritos.
author: Michelle S.

description: I tried their carne asada burrito. It was good and I was full after eating just half of it! The salsa they give with their chips was delicious! Did not like the other red and green salsa they had.
author: Isela G.

description: I love the super prawn burrito. I always thought that seafood tasted terrible when mixed with rice and beans but this taqueria showed me that I  was  wrong. This restaurant and el farolito are the best places to get Mexican food in the outter mission.
author: Karina G.

description:
***sounds familiar because I reviewed the wrong location....

First time here, but won't be my last.  This place is pretty fabulous.  I ordered the Shrimp Nachos, how many places can you get shrimp nachos?  They were fabulous.  Topped off with a Corona and some strange Bloody Mary type concoction, i'm definitely returning when I want good mexican food.  It tasted fresh and well-prepared.  The people are fairly nice and the fare is perfect for the meal.  Good price, good quality, yummy food!
author: Ronjini M.

description:
After a long meeting walking through my hood colleagues suggested Taqueria Corneta to have lunch. What I noticed was a bright, clean and spacious area to enjoy our meal. Went straight in line even with lots of situations going on at the register but staff are calm kept the line moving.

I ordered a Super Tostada which consisted of carne asada, avocado, beans, lettuce, sour cream, salsa, rice and a slice of tomato. The meal came with chips and I washed it down with agua fresca (melon) very full and happy. My colleagues were also very happy with their cheese enchiladas and burrito.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I'm definitely a fan.  I love that you can get a baby burrito, which won't leave you feeling miserably full or with an awkward amount of leftovers.  I always want to switch it up and try something new, but I can never turn down the carne asada.  It's so savory and juicy, and during my stint as a vegetarian, I really missed it.  You just can't get that flavor from anything else.

The verdict: a reliable place for quick and friendly service, great value, and a tasty meal.  Give it a shot.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Taco de lengua: weird cubes of not so tasty meat...in a red sauce? Made the tortilla soggy. No bueno.

Super taco de carnitas: meat was super tasty. I should have made it a regular taco, all the extra stuff was kind of unnecessary. 

Green salsa in squeeze bottles, no flava'.

In conclusion, not sure if I want to return for soggy tacos.
author: Hilda Z.

description: The burritos here are tasty and filling. They're what burritos should be, but nothing more than that. I'm reserving my 5th star for more wow factor, but this is a solid place to duck in for lunch.
author: Heather B.

description: Great service, great food and good people. If you like authentic then you'll like this place!  Try the Sangria for a special treat.
author: Tom P.

description: I have been going here since it opened in 1997. I today I ordered the crane asada plate. The meat was dry and over-cooked. The pico de gallo salsa was all green tomatoes. Not good. My salad had 4 salad cores and stem bottoms in it.  I gave them to the owner and he just threw them away. I won't be eating here any longer.
author: Erica K.

description:
Got the feeling it's a place you can stumble into, but that might just be because I was in a stumbly mood. 

Ate the Vegetarian Supreme Burrito, or something like that. It was hugenormous. In fact, I just ate the other half for La Corneta Taqueria dinner part 2.

 My only complaint is that it was cold, and a little bland. Half of that is my fault for ordering it stuffed to the gills with cold things like guac and sour cream, but the other half is their fault for having lukewarm black beans. 

Also, the churro was okay, not good, and certainly not great. I only ate it because it was there. 

Next time I'm getting something with meat. A mighty meaty burrit-y.
author: Emily D.

description: My all time favorite place to go to when I'm starving and In a rush. The food is fast and really good. Love the strawberry agua fresca.
author: Des A.

description: Still a great sports watching venue, even when not watching soccer.  I am watching Monday night football in a comfy, well lit environment with very affordable beer, tasty chips and salsa, and a friendly (non-)crowd.
author: Katharine N.

description: Really mixed feelings about this place. It's been my go to mission burrito spot for about six months. I like the space and the local crowd, and the food can be pretty good. But I'm kind of tired of inconsistent service and sloppy, careless burrito construction. Today for the 3rd time in a row I got a watery, loosely rolled mess. No effort to drain the pollo rojo before putting it on the tortilla, nor to spread ingredients evenly throughout. Even Pancho Villa - which serves like 5x the number of customers - takes more care.  I think it's time to move on.
author: Carl C.

description: So recently, I went to La Corneta, most of the times I've went it has been quick and food is always good. BUT recently..... I visited the Glen Park one and the times I've went they know what a "Chicken Cesar Salad" is. But this lady at Mission did not understand me one bit. I had ro repeat myself several times, she even called her co-worker and her co-worker was like WHAT? A Cesar salad... after waiting for another several minutes she came out with leaves, radish and Pachyrhizus erosus........... I JUST LEFT! BYE
author: Liset O.

description:
Totally fine taqueria. They have a big menu, which is nice (constant supply of churros! Theoretically great, but maybe not so fresh always!). It has a clean, chain-y feeling, which is slightly off-putting, but they keep everything moving through pretty quickly.

Anyway, the food. The baby burrito is a nice, actually edible size, as opposed to the usual behemoths in the mission. The pollo is salsa roja seemed to have a lot of white meat, which was tender and consistent, but a little boring. The spicy salsa had some jalepenos but was still on the mild side. I liked the carnitas more than I expected I would - they weren't too crispy but were pretty succulent. The carne asada was pretty good, too, although my dining companion was less impressed. The tortillas weren't too flavorful, disappointingly. Good fresh-squeezed orange juice.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I love the quesadillas here! The super prawn and steak quesadillas are both great and big enough to split between two people. The salsa and guac are also really fresh.

The secret beef soup is amaaazing. The beef is soo tender and lots of veggies... perfect for the day after a crazy night out.
author: Vivian H.

description: It's casual, so don't expect Michelin stars here, but their food is consistently delicious. I like the fact that they bbq their meat right there. The super burrito is enough for two people. Great bang for your buck!
author: L L.

description: Love this place! Clean, spacious, and plenty of seating! The food is also great! I love their quesadillas and burritos! I am a frequent customer and each time is never ever disappointing.
author: Sylvia K.

description: This place is hella nasty lol they have sexy employed but that's it ! If you want fresh meat I suggest to go to Mexico tipico or taqueria guadalajara the one by excelsior!!!
author: Xochitl F.

description:
There was a pretty big line at the El Faralito next to the Bart, so a group of us headed to this large empty taco joint.  Cause an empty place next to a crowded place is probably pretty good, eh?

The location is clean enough, the service friendly enough, and the menu had the right options.  However, flavor wise everybody I was with agreed that the burritos at La Corneta didn't measure up the Mission's usual high standards.  I think the flavor was a bit off, the proportion of veg to meat was a bit off.

I don't think I'll be back.
author: Ivan L.

description:
One thing that I don't people have mentioned here is that this place is an awesome place to drink. Unlike many taquerias, they have a full bar, and Bulleit was just $6 per (large) glass. We also had Patron and Don Julio Anejo for $9 per shot, which is pretty good for SF.

The ceviche was excellent, and it was served almost like nachos. They do a great job with the salsa and had the right ratio of tomatoes to onions to cilantro. I don't remember the name, but they have a chicken super nachos that might be the best I've had.

The staff was super welcoming and accommodating - even though we had finished our food and were just enjoying the bar, they gave us some chips and nachos, they set up extra tables for us, and we even got to enjoy a mariachi band iwth a blue violin.
author: Drew K.

description:
Overweight babies.

That would be La Corneta's massive baby burritos. Comes packed with the meat of your choice, or what I had, an outstanding tofu simmering in a mild red sauce. One scoop would have been appropriate. You get two.

Add in a generous serving of black beans and multiple tortilla options (including wheat) and you've got one of the best burritos in the Mission.

This is a good weight problem to have.
author: Jason B.

description:
Why so few reviews? After living seven years in the Mission, this is still my favorite taqueria. Clean and friendly with meat above average for a taqueria in the Mission. The grilled chicken and grilled steak (carne asada) aren't as burned as they are in many other establishments in the neighborhood.

It's perhaps slightly more expensive than other taquerias, but it more than makes up for it in quality. On a calorie-per-dollar scale, super tacos are probably a better value than the super burritos.
author: Jared B.

description: Mixed reviews here. First of all it's hard to find good carne asada in the bay. I don't know why but everyone cooks their carne asada until they're dry crispy beef jerky. But this place gets it right. But the draw back is the service blows. I ordered tacos and I wasn't asked if I want anything on them and they didn't even bother to put onions and cilantro on them.
author: Will D.

description:
Clean, fast, and tasty tasty tasty. The pintos have flavor and the chicken mole is really, really good. The horchata is refreshing and not too sweet and thick. The black beans are also really good. They have burritos and tacos too, if you're into that but their plates are what I came for.

A good selection of fish too: talapia, salmon, and shrimp. 

A family place more than a hipster place IMO, so minus a star for ambience.
author: Michael W.

description:
I'm so glad I discovered this place late into my time attending City College's Mission campus. This is a place that I would go to several times a week. And when the professors let us out early, I eagerly rushed here to see if I can get an order placed to go before they closed for the night.

The portions are huge, the menu choices are extensive, the chips are filling, service is unbelievably quick, and the food is fantastic. I enjoyed watching them grill the various meats as I go through their lines. This place is palacious and there are always available, clean seating. 

I don't give a damn if there are "better" or more "authentic" places in the Mission. I don't want to waste my time where hipsters and foodies eat. I want my food *now* and I know where to get it.
author: Ruiqiu K.

description:
got there around 9:30 pm on a Sunday.  got a carne burrito with no rice or beans...just meat, salsa and guacamole. The meat was cold and chewy, there were some beans thrown in there and the guac and the "spicy" salsa were bland. 

not my first choice of taquerias...I would MUCH rather have gone a few doors down to my beloved El Farolito, but my friend suggested this place. I most likely will not return, what with all the great options in the mission.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Best Mexican Food, Cool Live Latin Music and Super Cool Atmosphere are the best reasons why I chose La Corneta as my everyday Lunch place. 

The people work there are very friendly and cordial.

There are many different Dishes to choose from, However I liked the followings,

Super Fish Taco.
Super Prawn Burrito.
Super Chicken Burrito.
Shrimp & Carne Asada  Burrito.
Chicken Casadilla.

Si Te Gusta La Corneta, Llégale !!!!!!
author: Hasan A.

description: My friends are I love coming here for Mexican food, because they have delicious food at an affordable price! I usually get the tacos or burritos, so I'm not sure how their entrees are. The aqua freschos are very thrist-quenching!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Years later I still like this place, although the quality it's a bit inconsistent. One night was perfect and the following afternoon was less perfect.  The prawn taco kicks ass.  Nice size prawns, grilled to order, seasoned to perfection, juicy and delicious.  I love the baby bean burrito.  The refried beans are really good and simple. Perfect serving, perfect flavor.  I had fresh carrot juice (20oz) for cheap.  

One thing I don't like is that you sort of have to advocate for your condiments and toppings.  They aren't offered to you, if you don't ask (limes and cilantro for example).
author: Jen C.

description: One of the nicer and bigger taquerias in the city, truly. I ordered the quesadilla suiza with chicken and horchata. My coworker a carnitas burrito and another also got the quesadilla. Our dishes were bland and wanted for salsa and seasoning. It is less greasy as others have mentioned, and presentation is nice, but ultimately I have had better. Also, none of the employees smiled or looked happy. More on borderline angry. Maybe it was just an off day?
author: Shell I.

description: Pretty good.  The salads are good and so is the shrimp.    Chips arent great but they are always pretty friendly and place is really clean.  Good place for the more refined restaurant style mexican food.
author: Josh V.

description:
It is a cleaner version of every other tacqueria in the area. It is not so commercial as to be Taco Bell-ish, nor is it gritty enough to be street food brought indoors. It is a bright, open taqueria that takes credit cards. Rare indeed.

The band that plays in the center of the room is pretty cool.
author: Wes T.

description:
The food was delicious, and the burrito was huge. I paid about $9.71 (after tax) for a super prawn burrito which had prawns, rice, beans, guac, sour cream, cheese, and salsa. It was huge and tasty, but there were no more than maybe 8 prawns in the whole thing, which was unfortunate.

There was a ton of seating area, which was nice. I noticed that the entire menu was a decent bit pricier than a lot of the mission (for example, a single taco ran from $3-$5.50)...for a tiny taco! But the super burrito or quesadilla wasn't a bad deal.
author: Nikhil G.

description: The food looked so good so I expected it would taste good too. I was disappointed with the blandness of the food.  I was surprised considering how highly ranked this restaurant is.
author: Jane A.

description: Green pork is so succulent! It's bathed in this delicious green sauce. The prawns are huge! And they actually devein the prawns, a plus. I asked for pork and prawn burrito and came away with a delicious meal. Guacamole is tasty too. You'll enjoy it with the free chips that they give. :)
author: Lulu S.

description: These are some big tacos! I especially like it when there is a mariachi band playing :)
author: Mary C.

description:
Love Mexican food? Could do without all the beans and rice? Your answer is La Corneta! While they do have a full menu of combination plates with beans and rice, they also have a nice selection of a la carte items. Had a single chicken enchilada ($2.50) and a single chile relleno ($2.95). Enchilada was fat with chicken and the relleno was a poblano chili smothered in sauce. Both real flavorful and the cashier even added free chips and salsa! Left feeling satisfied without needing a siesta!

And at least on weekends, during lunch they have a 3-piece band that is surprisingly professional-sounding.
author: John G.

description:
Clean, tasty, roomy.

It's a big place, and there's always plenty of seating.  Sometimes on the weekend, there's a live band  (not just wandering mariachi) which is fun, except sometimes they're too loud.  In that area with the high ceiling, they really don't need electronic amplification.

The platos are all very generous.  I've found, though, that I like a little of that orange grease on my al pastor.  Here it's a little dry.  Also, they've got a heavy hand on the lettuce.  Those nachos look HUGE until you get past all that iceberg.

They've got a few different salsas, but most must be ordered at the counter.  On the table there is a simple (yet tasty) red and green salsa in "ketchup" squeeze bottles.  They do have a cebolla y jalapeno encurtida which is about the spiciest they have.

Although everyone else in my group swears they've seen it before, last visit was the first time I noticed the frijoles negros refritos, which is pretty much my favorite.
author: Ken B.

description: Delicious tacos, and an incredible value. I got a corn quesadilla, a salad, chips and salsa for $1.96. Highly recommend it. There was great live music while we were eating
author: Peter G.

description: Yelpers, you really screwed me on this one! I was craving Mexican, so we made a special trip over here on a Saturday, had to park 5 blocks away, walk by the disgusting urine infested Bart depot (made me gag before I even got there). We walked in and there was a line at the counter, but we must've looked the type who were going to sit down, so the waitress came up to us and asked (in Spanish) if we were going to "eat here" and she told us to sit down and she brought us a basked of chips and menus. The salsa with the chips was pico de gallo. There were also two bottle of salsa on the table. NONE of these salsas had any flavor. No lie. They lacked salt. I have a heart condition, so I'm not a big salt eater, so that should tell you something. I ended up ordering the baby burrito with chicken and mole because of all the rave reviews. She brought another salsa (making it 4 total different salsas). Again, no flavor. I had asked for no rice in the burrito (doesn't belong there!). But, they didn't put any cheese in it like the menu described. My husband got the super baby burrito with shrimp and his didn't have any cheese either. I don't usually eat burritos in Mexican restaurants, I think of them as Gringo food because I've traveled all over Mexico and actually lived part of the year in Jalisco, and they don't serve burritos unless it's in an American style restaurant. But, this food so lacked in flavor that I would be afraid to try the tacos. I also have to say although everyone speaks Spanish there, I don't think the operators of this Mexican restaurant are Mexican. They sound Central American and the food is more Central American style. If I want that, I would go down the street and have a pupusa or nacatamal. Central American food isn't typically as spicy as Mexican so I think my assumption is correct. I'm really surprised that it's so hard to find good Mexican in SF, but I'll keep trying.
author: Tess S.

description: I came here on a weekday in the afternoon after the lunch rush.  The two ladies taking orders didn't even say hello nor did they look me in the eye.  I found that to be utterly rude.  I didn't know which one was going to take my order because none of them took the initiative to want to take my order...so I just picked one. Both had a disgusted look like they didn't want to be there and I was bothering them. That being said, the burritos and nachos are good at La Corneta.  The only reason why I came to this location was because I was in the area.  I usually go to the one near Glen Park where the staff is much cordial but the food is pretty much the same so you know what to expect.
author: Review L.

description:
I've had tacos, quesadilla, seafood bowl, nachos, agua fresca.

The food is good and the price is right.
I like the ambiance too: families, solo eaters, people watching the game on the big screen(s)... oh, and mariachis!

* favorite order here is the garlic shrimp!
author: Faten A.

description:
when i arrived at la corneta the people behind the counter did not acknowledge my presence and it was clear that something about me did not appeal to them.  perhaps i was not a "type of person" they respect.  whatever the case may be if i ever go to a la corneta it will not be this location.  customers are people who arrive at your business to be welcomed not ignored and put off.  you can keep your lousy attitude and stale food for someone more like yourself!

personally offensive experience and prompting this review just for piece of mind.
author: Bob O.

description:
I've been eating here regularly for about 12 months now and I have to say, this is my favorite taqueria so far. Great selections, great prices, maybe my favorite horchata, huge portions, usually cilantro-heavy (which I love), friendly and quick staff, very spacious, very clean, well lit, new HDtv's on the wall.. Well you get the point, Its a 5-star taqueria to me.

Consistency is key for great taquerias. La Corneta has never dissapointed me, and that means a lot since i've been about 30 times. Most of the time I will have the Carne Asada Super Burritto w/everything, and a large horchata. comes out to about $11, and comes with chips/salsa. This meal will definitely fill you up, and if it doesn't, you have a tapeworm and you should see a doctor.

They also make Baby Burritto's for $4.50 if you aren't really hungry. If you and a friend want to split something, the Super Nachos ($7.75, same as the super burritto) are close to perfect, and a great portion size. Also excellent Carnitas for fans of pork.
author: Chris G.

description: Great huge burritos and an amazing fish quesadilla served by a very warm and welcoming waitress. The atmosphere is clean and cheerful and it seems to be a favorite of the locals ..... Excellent!
author: Virginia D.

description:
I brought an out of town guest to La Corneta and a we sat near a normal seeming woman. The woman sitting at a table near us projectile vomit her huge taco salad across her table. It was like the watching the Exorcist but in slow motion, with smell. I saw my small-town guest stare in horror. He was looking for reasons to hate San Francisco and La Corneta found him his all his reasons.

As I have visited more frequently to this restaurant I have compiled a mix of memories that are ranging from good to very upsetting. I think the Glen Park location is much cleaner. I don't have a huge problem with the food. Just bad memories are holding me back. They have good vegetarian options but the refried beans have lard in them, I like that they offer a baby burrito and sauteed mushrooms. I think La Corneta is in the same category/class as lets say Pancho Villa but not quite as good or clean.
author: Shannon Z.

description: My review is based on their shrimp and steak super burrito. O man, it was awesome! The ordering process is a little different than the Glenn Park location. The burrito maker will ask to take your order at the 'Order here' sign. He will write it down and they will make it. At the Glenn Park location, all the ingredients are in front of you.  At this location, the meats are in front of you and the salsa and sour cream items are on the back wall. Regardless, I did miss how the Glenn Park location makes the burrito right in front of you. The burrito maker was very nice. I got a bag full of chips with my separate bag for my two burritos! 5 solid stars for solid food.
author: Jeff H.

description: La Corneta Taqueria is one of the best restaurants for Mexican food. I have eaten here twice. First time, I ordered a regular burrito with meat beans, rice and salsa at their Glen Park location. Second time I ordered regular nachos with chips, beans, cheese and salsa. Overall, satisfying experience, good food and good service.
author: Bennett W.

description:
What is all the hype about people!? I got sucked in and waited on line for 10 minutes on a busy evening to get myself a baby super burrito and tamales. The carnitas in the burrito had a very unexciting taste. Guac was ok. I like that they give you the option to order a smaller burrito...because I was on a mission to try some tamales. Onto those...wow, what a disappointment. I got chicken. Even with the red sauce over them, the amount of filling was minimal and had little to no seasoning. 

To top it all off, got to the counter to pay with credit card because ya know says all over their menus (and the store too when I went) "We accept credit" only to get a "Sorry we're cash only now" at the register. 

There is better Mexican to be had in this city, that's for sure.
author: Steven H.

description:
Hungry on the way back from SFO, I decided to stop and try someplace new.

As I usually do in a new place, I asked "what's good"?  
First she answered "everything" and when I rolled my eyes, she said, try the combo #3, steak and shrimp.  So, I did.
The el pastor looked pretty good and I made a mental note to try that next time, but there is definitely a seadfood focus here.

For around $10, this was a huge portion of food, even more so when I discovered a second piece of steak hiding underneath!

The place is clean and bright, service is pretty speedy, and I didn't see live roaches or half-dead rats roaming the place like at some of La Corneta's neighboring taquerias.

My only complaint about the food was that the steak was a bit tough, and cutting it with the dinky plastic knife was difficult.

I would definitely return, especially with someone who might get freaked by the um, "urbanness" of the other taquerias around.

Update - a few days later, having the last statement above in mind, I returned, with family and mother-in-law in tow.  90% of the clientele was Mexican (or so I surmise), and there was a quartet playing, quite well.  The ambience was only enhanced by the music, and the food was pretty good (but not fabulous) again.  The horchata tasted weird, for some reason.

I have to conclude this is a 4 star place with 3 star food.
author: dan s.

description: Surly service and the city's most mediocre burrito. There's no reason to return here when La Taqueria is just steps down the block.
author: Larf P.

description:
This is the FANCY taqueria to go to when I want to be in a spacious place with regular mexican food.  If you want an  AMAZING taqueria then go to El Farolito * its just kinda tight in there and the bathroom is disgusting. Sorry just being a princess.

Back to la Corneta: The food is good but I was most excited when they added a salad to their menu. $7.95 with your choice of prawns, carne asada or chicken. Its a spring mix salad, carrots, tomatoes and jicama and balsamic vinagrette. I get the prawns which are nicely seasoned and grilled. 

Super Delish option when I am right on that block and dont want to eat a burrito the size of a baby.
author: Abcde Q.

description:
I Love their burritos! SOooo freakin good. I would say the best and cheapest burritos in the whole city. Definitely worth trying!
The place is very clean as well. I am not a fan of the main street that the place is on(kinda sketchy), but because the food is so good here, it makes up for it.
author: Yuliya K.

description: The best burrito ever!!! Jesus!! These guys know what they are doing !!! I felt I was in Mexico watching soccer game drinking my corona extra and eating supper burrito ... I should order one more to go so yummyya
author: Kevin S.

description:
Stopped in tonight for dinner with my in-laws. We were headed to El Farolito but it was busy and really lacks seating for a group of 5.

La Corneta was spacious and had more then enough room for our party, live music added to the atmosphere. 

The service was very attentive, pitchers of water, our server checked up on us at least 4 times. The food was also good, hefty portions for a reasonable price.

They have purple onion marinated with habenero, highly enjoyable. A good burn to add to any menu item. The salsa and chips were great too.

When a Mexican restraunt has actual Mexican people eating there, chances are its on point. La Corneta is good, definitely will eat here again.
author: Ralphy J.

description: My favorite taqueria because the flavor of their food is the best (try the shrimp tacos (w/o rice and beans though) or the bistek ranchero. Their chips are always thin and crispy and delicious, and their salsa molcajete is amazing.
author: Alyce K.

description: This is a good, clean spot to enjoy some real good food. Right away, the smell of the food will make your mouth water, only to confuse you in deciding what to order! They serve steaks, traditional plates, and the usual tacos and burritos. The place is nicely decorated and they keep the place clean.
author: Jose R.

description: Super Burritto with grilled chicken, xtra jalep's. Huge portions, super tasty, enough salt in food to last a year in your body. This is my favorite taco place in the city. Not as cheap as some places but you get twice the amount of food for a buck more.
author: Sigorney S.

description: I'm biased, I love this place from the very beginning, I remember working with the brothers on their Mission location many moons ago and attending its grand opening too. Its a neighborhood staple at glen park too.
author: Johnson H.

description: Pretty damn good. Rolled through here on a Sunday night after a long, tiring day at work. Decided to grab a carne asada "super baby burrito." For being a baby burrito, it was a pretty good size. Everything inside tasted fresh and delicious.
author: Sebastian C.

description:
Regular grilled chicken tacos - delicious! 

Lean and flavorful meat, black beans and salsa (mild or spicy). 

At $3 a regular taco, I couldn't believe how huge they were. I should've ordered just one. Big eyes, big stomach. Now back to running.
author: Cathy K.

description:
I've been getting the super baby burritos here and at the Glen Park location for years (2000!). I love this place--even more after I tried them out for catering yesterday 12/7/2013. 

We had them cater a 30 person party. We went with a buffet-style burrito/taco bar. We had carnitas, carne asada and grilled chicken. They brought a full compliment of sour cream, pico de gallo, and even guac! Tons of rice and black beans rounded out the mix. Oh, and we had flautas too. The whole thing delivered was less than $400 including tip. They brought plates and forks too. The food was just what I expect from La Coroneta--very, very tasty; well seasoned, and fresh. 

Aside from a little difficulty finding the venue, the whole experience was just what we wanted. Would I recommend them to a friend? For sure.  

We worked with a few folks when setting this up, sparked by a form through their website. Joel was the fellow who helped us initially. But everyone who picked up the phone--which simply calls the restaurant (not a special catering number) were super-polite and professional.

PS: my menu fave when I really want to go alls out is a mushroom quesadilla. It's got mad flavor--garlic and just the right amount of salt. Tons of mushrooms. Dang. I need one now.
author: Ben B.

description:
We dropped by here because their website listed menudo on the menu.  But when I tried to order a bowl, I was told they had menudo only on the weekends, a fact not mentioned on the menu.
But we decided to try other things.  My partner ordered garlic shrimp while I ordered the chili relleno plate. both for take-out.
When we got home, I discovered that my order was incorrect.  I asked for refried beans, but got whole beans.  Someone must have noticed the mistake because there was a very small plastic container of refried beans.
As for the meals, we both agreed that the food was mediocre.  My refried beans were good, but the whole beans were almost tasteless.  The Spanish rice was dry and also tasteless.  My relleno had a good coating and lots of cheese inside.  But the chili pepper was tasteless and very hard to cut, probably because it was stringy.
We also had agua frescas, which weren't very fruity and not sweet.
All in all, the minuses clearly outweighed the pluses.  We will NOT return.
author: Philip C.

description: Try the Chile verde,  so good, nice and bright place, good sservice
author: vijay v.

description: This is my favorite burrito place in SF. I've been eating here a few times per year for 10+ years and still love the food. I love the chicken burritos with variations of toppings. The veggie burritos are yummy too. The home made guacamole is yummy. The ingredients are fresh. The service is very fast. I love the colorful decor. I could do without pictures of Jesus on the walls, but hey, it's the Mission and it's family owned Latino restaurant so I can cope with that - especially since the pics are hand painted murals that are quite lovely. Thank goodness we still have some family owned Latino businesses left in the Mission! My only complaint is that when they have live music, the volume is just too darn loud. Because of that volume it's impossible to have a conversation with someone even when sitting on the opposite side of the restaurant. Can they lower the volume?
author: John C.

description:
Food is like every other taqueria, nothing special.  But 23rd & Mission location has FUNNY MATH if you eat in.  Take out prices sometimes have FUNNY MATH too.  The wall prices don't match what they charge you.  You bring it to their attention and they simply say "Oh" and stare at you. So I guess it's their way of making sure their tip is  built-in. But it's the principle of the matter, you have a large menu displayed with one price and you charge me an extra $2.  Why do they think it's ok?  There's no service they provide in take-out but they still overcharge.  BEWARE!!
This has happened to us more than once, once eating in, and another two times for take-out, so perhaps they hope you don't catch it.
author: Sfbay N.

description:
The Super Burritos at La Corneta are so good!

This is Definitely my favorite spot on mission.

They also have restaurants all over the bay area...Iv basically been to them all.
Check it out!
author: Anthony G.

description: Best place on the mission. Clean good food and are willing to make off menu items. I had them make me a steak and shrimp fajitas super burrito that was amazing. Lines can be long sometimes but well worth the wait.
author: BayAreaFoodGuy Y.

description:
I am a El Farolito junkie.  El Farolito is very close to La Corneta so it took me awhile to try them out.  El Farolito isn't exactly clean inside and one time when it was stinky and full of flies I decided to try La Corneta Taqueria instead.  I like to try all the taquerias because I like variety although I am always tempted to go back to the usual spots.

So I went inside La Corneta and they had something El Farolito didn't have at the time (a decade ago) which was shrimp burittos.  I tried one and I got totally hooked.  For awhile I was always going to La Corneta and getting their delicious shrimp all the time.  Was it shrimp or was it prawns?  I can't recall, anyways, they were delicious.  

I haven't been back there a long time because I don't work in the area anymore.  Plus El Farolito is always open after the bars close and La Corneta isn't.  Also I am super addicted to El Farolito's veggie tortas.  

La Corneta is one of the more expensive taquerias in the mission because the interior is fancier.  Friendly cashiers back in the day.  Food was just fine.  However La Corneta seems a bit out of place because it seems more like a taqueria you would find in the suburbs.  However I noticed that locals have embraced it so good for them.  You can never have enough taquerias.  I love Mexican food.

Minus one star for price.  If you go to the Mission you want yummy Mexican food for cheap, isn't that what it's all about.  If you want something less expensive with a true Mission District feel to it go to San Jose Taqueria or La Taqueria.

To be honest I am afraid to park my car in the Mission these days.  I am worried someone is going to scratch it.  Too many times people have leaned on my car.  Plus it just doesn't feel safe for a Caucasion transsexual who is often by herself.  I don't wear a beanie and a big puffy gangster looking jacket anymore.  I have left the jacket and the Mission in my past.  Let somebody else risk their life for a taco, because I ain't the one.  Sure, 24th and Mission area is safer than 16th and Mission, but it still isn't that great.  I worked at a photo lab at 24th and Mission for years and saw lots of bad things.  What kinds of things?  You don't want to know.
author: Cynthia B.

description: My super fish burrito and my friend's super veggie burrito both sucked. Cold cheese. No sour cream or guacamole. Crap food and bland flavor. Cold burrito? Seriously? There are way better taquerias close by. I don't know why everyone on yelp loves this place.
author: Kristen F.

description: I've lived in the Mission 8 years and have my pick of tacquerias.  Taquera La Altena was the one I used to go to, but with the Mission fire in the building above it I had to try another one.  I also like Taqueria Guadalajara on 24th and Shotwell (Their salsas are awesome).  In search of a new taqueria close to where I live, I found this place.  I think the burritos here are very good.  I really like the carne asada burrito with shrimp.  It's $9.30 but they put 6 huge shrimp in them.  It's really nice to watch them cook it in front of you as well.  The carne asada doesn't have big hunks of fat in it like I've seen at a lot of places.  They are also one of the few places that has a chile relleno burrito.  Like every other taqueria I've seen it's usually cold in a fridge and they microwave it on a plastic?! (I assume microwave safe, I hate putting anything plastic in the microwave) plate.  Their sliced jalapenos are AMAZING.  The lady behind the counter told me they make them there.  It tastes like they put oregano in the vinegar.  Their whole jalapenos are great as well.  My only problems with this place is the fact that you have to ask for salsa and jalapenos.  Depending on who is working I can get dirty looks and I feel like I am a beggar or trying to rip them off.  They are usually so busy you really have to be aggressive in asking.  I like how most taquerias have a self serve bar, but that can get disgusting if the clientele let the salsas fall into each other.  You would think that it is more sanitary that the workers get the salsa for you, but I've seen times where it is busy and the workers (and I believe owner) dips a plastic container into the salsa with his bare hands after operating the register.  Not very sanitary as I am a germ freak.  However, I do notice MOST of the time they are washing their hands after operating the register.  I haven't got sick yet, so far so good!  I advise you also to call ahead with your orders.  This place is popular and sometimes I would get behind a family that ordered 5-10 burritos and it really holds everyone up.  The to-go order over the phone really gets your order done quickly.  All in all this is a great place.  I only took off one star for the handwashing I've observed.
author: Tyler J.

description:
Came here on the recommendation of a friend who had enjoyed the original location from its founding until now.  While my original intent was to get a burrito, a chile relleno plate with rice and beans was the same price, so I got it instead.  

I was a little dismayed when they pulled a cold pair of chile rellenos from a plate, topped them with cheese, put the beans and rice on the dish and then threw it all in the microwave for a few minutes.  I don't need to go out for microwavable food, I can make that at home.

Needless to sale, the dish ended up hot on the outside and cold on the inside.  It was not hugely tasteful either.  Salsa and chips were mediocre (bland,watery salsa, cold chips).  Overall it was a pretty poor effort that left me with a bit of a stomach ache as it all settled in a dense ball after dinner.
author: Eric M.

description:
I randomly stumbled upon this clean looking taqueria during the SF food fair/fest. I was super hungry and didn't want to wait in line for food booths during the fest so wandered here!!

I ordered a pork tamale and some enchiladas. The pork tamale was a bit dry for me, but it wasn't too bad. Enchiladas were pretty good. 

Oh oh and there was a band playing here! That was pretty cool, pretty epic string trio goin' on.
author: Jenn L.

description:
I had a Chile Relleno plate there and they were the blandest of the bland. The Chilies had no taste, the cheese had no taste and the sauce had no taste. Also their Pico de Gallo had zero flavor. The Refried beans were good however. The Chips were good.I Think the problem with this place is they use crappy produce, the most flavorless tomatoes, lettuce , ect.
My Friend's burrito was decent looking..  I don't think I will be back.. I think this is one of those places people go to for the GIGANTIC  portions, not quality. One burrito is the size of a human arm.
author: Jason C.

description: Bigger than the Glen Park location.  Its good food, clean, & will fry you a hard shelled taco when asked. What more can you ask for?
author: Star B.

description:
Apparently I got a bit wasted at Kiji (see my review of that restaurant), so my friends and I needed some pick-me-up food.  

We stopped by here, attracted by the bright lights on a Friday night.  I got a chorizo burrito and a horchata.  I know it's simple food but I was pretty satisfied by the end (and near sober).

My only gripe is that perhaps it should be open later on weekends perhaps?  But that's okay I suppose.
author: Ren L.

description:
La Corneta is like the big brother on the block. It's not your typical hole in the wall taqueria, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. They always give huge portions regardless of what you order.

I like the fact that they accept credit cards. Too many businesses these days try to keep costs low and do business under the table, but it's a big inconvenience to their customers.

I'm a huge agua fresca fan, and this place has several options: usually mango, strawberry, cantaloupe, and horchata. Get a large to enjoy with your meal, you won't be sorry.

I almost always get carnitas as my meat, whether I'm eating tacos or a burrito. The one thing that does bother me a bit is that they always microwave the carnitas, likely because they cooked the meat earlier in the day. Otherwise, I would've given this place 5 stars.
author: John C.

description: Absolute great catering deal from La Carneta. Food delivery was about 15 minutes late, but oh boy was the food good.  I was happy this worked out for our staff holiday spread and there were plenty of leftovers for lunch the next day for the office.  The flan for dessert was excellent!  Would definitely order from them again.
author: Emy B.
