friend: maybe it has a red cape attached to it.
me: [blank face, trying to think..] *3 secs later*... OHHHH!! HAHAHAHHA. cuz its SUPER!!! AHHAHAHA

i'm slow at getting jokes. and being starving made me 10 times even slower. so anyways i ordered a 'super baby burrito with chicken and no beans' (baby=smaller portion, and super=comes w/everything) and a bottle of sangria (even though it was non-alcoholic, it was was HELLA GOOD).  the meal was perfect, i savored every bite of that burrito. and before i left, i even got a churro to go for later :)

in addition, the atmosphere was awesome -- they had a live bossanova band playing, and the high ceiling sun roof w/the little balconies with flowers on the walls made it seem like we were eating outdoors. a great place for families and cute for couples on a date ;) *hint hint*, i loooooove mexican food now! hahahah jk 


p.s., don't let the homocide sign deter you from eating here, the food is reaaally good!!! :D
author: Jennie L.

description:
Well, first off , it was not my idea to come to this place.
It looks too commercial, and the yellow paint seriously hurts me eyes.
I was dragged in by a friend , and I opted to make the best of it.
The following is a transcript of what happened when I placed my order:

Lady: hello, wat can I get you
Me: a burrito
Lady: wat kind of tortilla
Me: Spinich
Lady wat type of meat
Me: beef
Lady: hu?
Me: beef
Lady Hu?
Me: BEEF
Lady: hu, I  . . .
Me: BEEF, COW you know MOOOOOOOOO
Lady : HU ?

I walked out, this time I dragged my friend out laughing at me for mooing at her.
author: Alex F.

description:
My friends and I have been going to La Corneta every Tuesday and Thursday for the past 6 years.  We usually roll really deep (about 10-15 of us) and the reason we always go here is because they can always accomadate us. 

First off, it is clean.  For those of you that know good Mexican food in the Mission, (unfortunately) 'clean' typically does go with 'good.'  So, no, i would not put La corneta in the same caliber as La Taqueria or Farolito but their food is always consistent and their prices are good.

I usually get the shrimp or salmon tacos.  They cook the seafood well and they are not stingy.  When I am really hungry, I will splurge and get the shrimp and mushroom quesadilla.  Now that is good (a little oily at times) BUT really good.  The Burritos are average but good if you are hungry.
author: L A.

description:
La Corneta is a good option for mexican food. The Salmon quesadilla is very good, and if you are up early you might be able to try their salpicon de marisco/ ceviche, which is pretty good. 
For a day were u feel like "Starving Marving", go for one of the plates like carne asada with rice and salad, that should fill you up and give u enough strenght to build a cathedral or hybernate like a bear for months... This place is a little bigger than the one on Glen Park and have live music sometimes. Their price did not go up crazy after they become known and that the quality of the food is consistant.
author: Candido B.

description: Plenty of seating, great prices, tons of options, and delicious food.
author: Janet R.

description:
I did a search on "Foxy Taco" and well you know that La Corneta came up. I'm sure if I did another search on "Clean bathrooms" it would come up as well! I used to walk by this place when they first built it, pointing and snickering, because I was on my way to get the very best Jesus-sized Quesadilla suiza at El Farolito's. After one too many run-ins with a needle-wielding crackhead and a line-ogling 2:00 a.m. crowd at 'Farolito's, I thought I test out the Uberclean, well lighted and nice smelling La Corneta. Guess what? Cleanest bathroom in the Mission (has HOT water), funnest Sunday 'eeh-unh-eeh-unh-eeh' mariachi and the nicest staff on the planet. The Food? I pretty much stick to my $2.50 Super Foxy Taco meal and free chips since I'm an UBER cheapskate, but I recommend going for the open air atmosphere and good vibe. 


pms: I've actually gotten free meals from the peeps there, but that's like price switching at Community Thrift, you feel like you're breakin the law, it's so cheap already!
author: Nettie K.

description: Inconsistent is how I'd judge La Coroneta.I love the carne asada and the rice and beans are tasty but it's a mixed bag, some menu items are really strange concoctions. Yesterday I went with a barely mobile person and one of their staff came to hold the front door both coming and going, and was exceptionally polite. Yet, their cashiers are often brusque and frequently overcharge. To go orders are often incorrect and missing items so you have to review your take-out bag before leaving. On my last visit I ordered my usual carne asada plate and they forgot the tortillas. I went to the cashier to request the missing tortillas, and she responded you want MORE tortillas like she was doing me a huge favor and I was abusing their kindness! If I wanted more tortillas I would have asked for more tortillas, I wanted the damned tortillas that were included with the order. A minor point but when you are treated like crap it ruins the experience. Why do ignorant cashiers feel so omnipotent?  Very good food five stars but  lousy customer service zero stars. The Glen Park branch is more pleasant but the food isn't as good. La Cumbre is a good alternative but they load their tacos/burritos with rice.
author: Alex B.

description:
Excellent tacos.  My friend got a fish taco, which turned out to be salmon, something I'd never had in a taco before.  The salmon was easily the best single dish I'd tried during our entire wandering of the Mission and stopping at tacquerias.  It was simply seasoned, with salt and pepper, and then chargrilled to the perfect consistency and an excellent crust.  Amazing.

I got a chicken baby burrito, and it was good, but not super noteworthy.  Definitely more charred than a few places, which I like.

The interior of this place is strange and huge, but there is ample seating and some good natural light.  If this were in New York, I would eat here every day and be a total lardass.
author: Nils J.

description:
"I think I'm afraid of it because it's so clean."

"This place just isn't HIP enough!  It needs to be DIRTY!  How can I believe that I'm GENTRIFYING if I can eat off the TABLES?!?!"

Stop it.  La Corneta is the cleanest taqueria around, but it's also the best.  It's the exception to the good-food-and-clean-establishments-are-inversely-correlated rule.

Get a burrito with the chicken in red sauce or the chicken in green sauce.  It's to die for.
author: Matt S.

description:
This place is one of the cleanest taquerias I've ever been to.  And the cleanliness doesn't come with a cost either, their prices are amazingly inexpensive, and are even lower than some neighboring competitors that like to charge for every addition and even exclusion of condiments (*ahem*cough* La Taqueria *cough*ahem*).  The ambiance is great, too.  The brightly colored murals on the walls and the live music makes for a really pleasant meal.

Cleanliness and ambiance aside, the food is good too.  My all-time favorite here is the carne asada.  It is so flavorful and with every bite, you can taste that fresh straight-off-the-grill flavor.  I like the portion sizes here too.  A regular baby burrito is perfect for me, meaning I can get a full meal for only $4.00 here!  What a deal!
author: Diane L.

description:
Great fresh ingredients in my Super Veggie Burrito, flavorful spicy salsa, and quick service. The tortilla wrap was a little more on the stretchy/soft side than I'm used to, but it didn't take away from the overall experience. I felt like their prices were sort of on the high side for a burrito joint - my burrito and chips came out to about $7 - but the quality was certainly high. 

They were awfully nice to even let us in tonight. They close at 10pm on week nights (at least on Monday's), but they let us in at 10 minutes past. We sat a nice clean table until nearly 11pm and no one complained.
author: Phil K.

description: A great Mexican taqueria in the City. Delicious and generous servings. Terrific friendly staff. Mexican band on the weekends.
author: Jon r.

description:
This is by far, one of the absolute best burrito/quesadilla places in SF.  Hands down.  If you're a fan of the burrito on the moister side of the spectrum then head here and indulge.  And if you're stomach isn't feeling to large, you can order a "baby" sized burrito.  

Everything is super fresh from their shrimp to the beans and avocados.  Mmm... 

The lines can get a little hectic, but don't let them ruin the experience.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
This is a good place if you want to eat authentic Mexican food. The place is clean, well-lighted and plenty of tables for seating. The price is moderate and the food is yummy & delicious. I tried the super burrito w/prawn and quesadilla w/prawns..so good. 

The bad thing is the parking is pretty bad in the Mission District.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I've spent a LOT of time talking "burritos" with various friends, family members, and coworkers and La Corneta is one of those spots that keeps working its way into the conversation. I finally decided to do a little research on my own which took the form of a Carnitas super burrito. I like trying Carniatas at new spots because its one of those meats thats really easy to see if it was cooked well, badly, or decently. Too fatty? Too dry? To salty? Not seasoned enough? Carnitas is a great indicator of the quality of the ingredients, and the carnitas were pretty good. 

All in all the burrito was pretty tasty although there was nothing particularly special about it: just your run of the mill burrito. That said, sometimes all you need is a plain jane run of the mill burrito and La Corneta fills that requirement beautifully. They also keep their place nice and clean which for me, when you're talking burrito joints in the mission, is deserving of another star right on its own. 

Its not going to be "the spot" I show off to all my out of town friends who have never had an AMAZING burrito before, but I'd definitely go back if I was just looking for a quick & easy, tasty burrito.
author: Jeff S.

description: I'm real picky about the Mexican food, I consider myself an expert in this field by default. I don't believe a Mexican restaurant can do everything well so I give them 1 star off. But their chips and salsa are the highlight of this place. Their salsa tastes like my abuela's salsa, enough said. Everything else on the menu is pretty good and typically doesn't disappoint me
author: Lettie M.

description:
La Corneta was one of the first restaurants recommended to me when I moved to SF almost 5 years ago.  Yesterday, I craved the nachos--nothing else would do.  We braved the rain, and for $20 the two of us now have leftovers for a week.

In any other town--this would be the only taqueria to patronize.  Gotta love the food in SF.

If El Tonayense wasn't  1/3 of a block from my house, I would eat here most every day.
author: Scott H.

description:
I am not a big fan of mexican food, but somehow I got drawn into this place by the sound from the band (they happened to have live music that night, which was very very good), the smell of freshly cooked meat, and the very bright and warm atmosphere, especially when it was wet, cold and dark out.

Definitely five stars for the service.  As soon as I sat down, I got served warm crunchy tortilla chips with fried beans, guacamole, and fresh salsa...PLUS a sample of sangria.  Everything was yummy (so far)....then,  I ordered tamales and ended up not liking them because they did not taste like the ones I had in Mexico, and they tasted really bland.  Though I did not complain, I didn't end up eating much of my food.  A few minutes later, the owner came to apologize for the fact that they didn't cook their tamales right.  He told me that he would change the way they cook them next time, and they would definitely be better.  And somehow, I felt being treated like a family member instead of a customer.   I got the feeling that the owner really did care about the customers and his food more than just his business.  My gut feeling was right on, especially when it came to check time.  I realized that I wasn't charged for the tamales, though I insisted in paying for my food.  

Sometimes, it's nice to know that there are some compassion and care out there in this world.
author: Numrin T.

description:
It's sad when a place you frequented goes downhill. I used to eat here a few times a week when they first opened. I maintain the 2nd star for clean decor only, but unfortunately the quality and flavor have steadily gone down on my past several visits. Sad..... 

The salsas were so good, now they're prepacked and taste like salsa infused water. The dishes taste pretty mediocre now and are buried under the extras (I used to get the prawn or al pastor tacos). Last two visits the server messed up our order, after a very long wait. 

Good bye old fave :(
author: Antoi C.

description:
This place is great, albeit a bit expensive as taquerias go.

I have to recommend the super prawn burrito. It's so damned good it'll make your head explode.

Pair that with a Negro Modelo and you'll have a fine meal, my friend.
author: Mark G.

description:
La Corneta is by far the BEST taqueria in SF.  Luckily, this de-lish spot is in my 'hood.

I've tried a number of items on the menu, and have been satiated with every one.  The steak and shrimp plate is awesome, and so reasonably priced!!!  And their green salsa is my most favorite.

The ingredients are always fresh, and you can either eat there (clean tables) or order for take away.
author: Brandy S.

description:
The place is really nice; high ceilings, big glass doors, walls painted with murals, and lots of spaced out seating.  

They have music on the weekends, so that's really fun.

What I love most about this place besides their burritos is that you see all kinds of different people enjoying their food.  On one weekend, I saw suits, families with kids, regular joes, and super grungy punk rockers.  It's kind of proof that everyone loves La Corneta's food!

I love that they have baby burritos because it is the perfect portion for someone like me.  Their carnitas was so freaking tender and not overly salty like most places.  I love their burritos because I don't feel like I'm going to die after I finish one.  They also give you free chips and a very small portion of salsa with your order.  Somehow, the salsa is enough to last for most of your chips... it's weird.
author: Anna T.

description:
The food here is the bomb.  I really liked the Horchata, Agua's fresca, and the Leche' De Nalgas. 

Nice place to sit down and they have sky light.  Also a big plus was the salsa at the table.  Two different kinds in ketchup bottles.
author: Shawn L.

description: Seriously good tacos. I was skeptical because La Corneta didn't initially look as authentic as the other taquerias on Mission- it's bright, clean, and huge inside. The menu is in English. But my friend and I were both pleasantly surprised. $3 tacos served with mounds of fresh salsa and guacamole. The spicy salsa was actually spicy and I didn't have to worry about chunks of meat ending up in my vegetarian tacos. I ordered 2 tacos, but could only eat one. They're that big. I didn't order the OJ, but it's $1.50 for a fresh glass. I need to move to SF!
author: Pria P.

description: La Corneta is my favorite taqueria in the city: not only are their prices reasonable, but their portion sizes are huge. If you're near 24th street BART or if you want to grab food for an afternoon at Dolores, La Corneta is an excellent choice. As another poster noted, their salmon burrito is to die for; I highly recommend it
author: Walter L.

description: Mmmm the carne asada here was very good! I had a carne asada quesadilla and lots of roja salsa on the side. mmm. I left so incredibly full, my wallet not hurting so bad, and thinking of all the other kinds of things I wanted to try on the menu. Guess I'll be back :)
author: Lauren S.

description:
At La Corneta (which is conveniently placed near my bank) I pretty much get one of two food items.  The food item I will mention is the Super Chicken Tostada.  I love!  I cherish!  that moment when I want to eat a super greasy corn tortilla which is loaded up with lettuce, I ask for extra, sour cream, Guacamole, Salsa, Black Beans (I ask for less) and Rice, I also ask for less.  Oh and, Lots o' limes.  Ever since I was in Oaxaca in Southern Mexico, I learned that I really love to douse most of my latin american/mexican meals with some lime.

So of course I add salsa, which is now extra specially protected since the health department came down on them for open jar containers (that was their only ding).  I also get extra chips to eat my meal with.  Have I mentioned that I really hate to eat with forks.  Give me chopsticks, chips, chapati, naan, whatever!  I hate forks.  

Another thing that I love about this place is the interior painting.  I personally borrowed their color scheme and their faux mode of painting and did my rather large sectioned hallway in the same yellow and gold color scheme.  and the murals are bright, lively, cheerful and well done.

Oh another thing, the owner, i forget his name, but he is such a caballero.  So nice to customers and seemingly really kind to his employees.  They stay for a long time so lets hope that they are happy, well paid, and treated fairly.

Last thing, my god-daughters love to go there and we really enjoy a lunch or dinner and everyone is satiated food wise.
author: Leslie I.

description:
If you make it here- first good job.  This is the holy land for beef and shrimp quesadilla- OMG they are HUGE and tasty.  Nicely toasted tortilla with hige portions of meat and cheese.

Want something else because you have had that already 50x?  Ok then get the carne asada- steak plate.  They will give you a huge slab of steak and all the fixins.

This place is cool as it is much larger than the other tacquerias so you arent elbow to elbow and worried about your neighboring table spilling their salsa on you in their drunken stupor....oops I mean mine.
author: Rob C.

description:
This is a great taqueria. 
The ambiance is nice, with plenty of seating. 

The baby burritos are pretty darn big and plenty enough for me at $5.50 for a super. The burritos are great tasting and a super value.

They come with tons of delicious chips and salsa.
author: Chili B.

description: This is a great taqueria! I had the super prawn tacos but now I'm anxious to go back and try something else. The ingredients are fresh and tasty! The tacos were overstuffed so I actually had to eat them with a fork and knife. The tacos were not greasy, nor were the tortilla chips which came with 2 different kinds of homemade salsa. The prices are reasonable, maybe a bit higher than other places in the Mission but definitely worth it. I am also a stickler when it comes to the cleanliness of a restaurant, and this place passed.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
FRESH FRESH!

I love the food, decor, cute ladies behind the bar...!!! You have to try their Sangria, it is one of the best ones I've ever had. Their prawn tacos are soooooooo good.

Parking sux but do you really expect to find parking in the mission?!?
Service was awesome! I will dftly be coming back to try their quesadillas!
author: Diana N.

description: I came to this place about 2 years ago and the food was awesome.... I came back for the first time and the food was not the same. The meat tasted as if it was out for a few days, there was no flavor. The horchata was extremely watered down. The food is absolutely not worth the price.
author: Anjelica R.

description: Quick service and great tasting food. Great flavor without over doing any particular seasoning. Meats seem to be trimmed of excess fat so all you get is really good flavor. I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food, but when I'm in the mood, I go here. Good price and great quality food.
author: Christine G.

description:
Honestly, if I had to decide on my last meal, a super baby chicken burrito from La Corneta would likely be it.  When I'm out of town, this is the food that I crave, and you can bet that on my 2 days off/month, I'm going to be eating here one of those days.  I've even stopped here on the way back home from th airport.

What makes La Corneta better than the rest?  We think it might be the beans--the food is a touch better than lots of the other taquerias.  The fresh salsa certainly helps.  But it's also that the staff is so kind and super-efficient.  This place is hopping all day long, but they never miss a beat and somehow manage to maintain an even keel, despite the hordes of people who can't seem to make up their mind about what to eat.  Also recommended:  anything with carnitas, the tacos and the enchilada plates.  Someday I'm going to try something with shrimp, which always looks & smells so good, but I've got to get past that super chicken burrito, the stuff of my dreams.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Their chicken quesadillas, pork tamales and chille rellenos are gOOd.  Pork tamales come with a yummy sauce and melted cheese on top.  Who could ask for more?  I find their rice and beans to be kinda plain so I always order a la carte rather than get a plate or combo.

Their burritos were blah.  I like gordo's for burritos.

Sketchy neighboorhood but the ambiance is good inside.
author: Serena H.

description:
Geeeee. Super baby with mole de pollo? Yes please. I haven't found anywhere else that has mole de pollo. And the super baby has all the goodness you want, without that overstuffed, undo the fly feeling of a full Super.

I haven't tried anything else on the menu. The churros look damn tasty though.
author: Matt L.

description: Yeah, it's the clean Mission Burrito place.  I like the Diamond Street location too, but usually when I'm in the city, this one is more convenient.  The fish burrito (big slab of salmon, cooked on the grill) is unlike anything I've had anywhere else--and there are so many choices on the menu I doubt I'll ever get to them all.  While there are plenty of other great places for Mexican food in the Mission, this is a good one because the food is consistently excellent and it's big, clean and yep - clean bathrooms too.
author: Matt K.

description: Now that I've moved back to the haight i miss this place...  lil chahuahua is a decent subsititute, but La Corneta still has the best prawn & mushroom (yes, it's a great combination) burritos in town.
author: Willy c.

description:
2013 UPDATE:
Not quite what it used to be.  Burrito (super baby) was soggy and overall not flavorful...lacking seasoning like salt?  Husband had tacos that also disappointed.  Maybe it was an off day (Saturday evening).  Would give it another try but now with some hesitation.  

2006 Review:
You can't beat the quality & prices...good fast service and just a really great meal.   Nice murals too.
author: M S.

description:
Ordered: Carne asada nachos, carne asada taco, and a large horchata.

Their chips are hand made.  They are a little thin so they break easily when digging into your food but they taste delicious.  Their lettuce was soooo freshly cut it was amazing.

Their meat was incredibly well cooked and seasoned.

Their salsa was fresh but not impressive.  Amongst the other items you'd hardly care.  (Note: they offer mild and hotter salsas)

Their horchata had the perfect flavor except that it was a tad too powdery.

The carne asada taco was a steal!!  I couldn't believe how much they put on that corn tortilla for the price.

The atmosphere is very clean and pleasant.  When I went on a Saturday, they had a guitarist and bassist sing songs while we ate, though I don't know if it's a routine thing every weekend.

On the whole, this is the best taqueria in San Francisco that I've been to yet.
author: Pickles T.

description:
So it was lunchtime working at a new location and I had a little dilemma, where to eat. Across the street was my tried-and-true El Farolito, although this location I haven't tried before, and a huge selection of other restaurants in the area. On the advice of my manager for the day, I went to La Corneta on the same block as El Farolito.

This place was big, with lots of seating, lots of employees, and lots of choices on the menu. I saw churros at the counter and I had to get one, not such a good idea. It was rubbery and cold even though it was sitting under a heat lamp. I ordered my usual super burrito with carnitas, also not spectacular, considerably smaller than super burritos I've had at any other taqueria, and more expensive too. 

I placed my order stepped to the side to wait and watched everyone behind me order and get their food right away. After about 10 customers I started to wonder. So I walked up and asked, the cashier had apparently lost my order and she knew I was waiting. Someone else came up and fixed my order right on the spot.

Definitely would not go there again.
author: Felix T.

description: This spot is clean and serves good food.  You will not be hungry after eating here.  I'm partial to the shrimp and carne asada super burrito.  As with any restaurant there are lines during peak times, but the service is fast and they get through the line pretty quick.
author: Jenny B.

description:
I've eaten at a few mexican restaurants in the Mission and there is no other mexican restaurant as good as this place.

NO JOKE, I love their steak and prawn super burritos! They cook it right in front of you and they are not shy with the butter, prawn, and steak. They will make the burrito the way you like it and they use very fresh ingredients.
I've also tried their nachos, which are thee BOMB-DIGGITY (can share with 2 other people) and the chille relleno, tacos, and pretty much everything on the menu. All the desserts all taste homemade and are very authentic (flaun, churro, etc)

On certain Sundays, they have live mariachi music and the atmosphere is spacious, bright, and full of color, just like the food. The restaurant is VERY CLEAN and the service is great too. The workers are always so helpful and nice.

I know this place is "fresh-mex" kidn of mexican food but the prices are very reasonable for the exceptional food you get! =)
author: Hillary M.

description: I LOVE La Corneta. I've always ordered over the phone for pick-up and occasionally they've gotten small details of my order wrong. Sometimes they're shady with the chips and salsa too. I would recommend you eat there to get your money's worth. From what I know, the portions are pretty big, the prices are reasonable, and the steak and prawns super burrito is SOOOOO good, and NOT SKIMPY!  My absolute favorite!!
author: Joraine C.

description: Sangria was GREAT!  Lots of locals eat there.  Food was very good.  Great Music. (live band).  Plenty of room.  Try it, you'll like it.
author: Kerry L.

description:
Good Burrito Fast.  It's assembly line fast.  

Clean spot
Lots of places to sit
A little bit more expensive than El Farolito, but if you are in a rush then this is your place.
Get the Rice Milk (horchata) and get the large as it's a better deal.
author: Po L.

description: Well after enduring Hawaii's horrible Mexican restaurants, I have to upgrade my star rating for this place on my latest visit to SF. Totally awesome chile verde pollo, mole poblana, and tostadas which are fresh and delectable! Now if I could only convince them to open a branch in Honolulu!!
author: Marc K.

description: Very good! The super Taco is the biggest Taco I have ever had and was delicious. Don't waste your time at Pancho Villa.
author: Neil W.

description: Delicious. Cheap. Clean. Quick Service. I've tried quite a few taquerias in the Mission and this is one of the best ones.
author: Saquib P.

description:
Sparkling clean.........
Ridiculous portions for really reasonable prices........
Good food......
Quality ingredients...........
I really don't understand why anyone would go to El Farlito down the street (which for some unknown reason people seem to like) unless its after two in the morning your wasted and everything else is closed........Then its great
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Every time that I go to a taqueria that isn't La Corneta I beat myself up about it all day long. "I should have gone to La Corneta." This happens very rarely-if ever.
BTW-This one is a little better than the Glen Park version.
When I want taqueria food:
No brainer. La Corneta.
author: SF N.

description:
Best burrito ever. 
Quickest, most honest review ever.
Done.

OK.. meal size taco for $2.50 also isn't too shabby.
author: Matty G.

description: Good food, good price, and large portions.    Bright, clean, and airy dining room with friendly staff.
author: Mike T.

description: Tried a burrito here a couple times over the past year, and they just weren't anything to write home about. Not bad, but not spectacular or really flavorful either.
author: J K.

description:
it's been bugging me that all my farolito proselytizing lacks a certain amount of cred, street cred, that is.  i love their shrimp but if i'm gonna be trustworthy, i need to try the other taquerias in the hood, at the very least the ones on the same street.  

i tried this place for the first time last night.  but for some reason i still couldn't get myself to order the shrimp.  it felt wrong not to be getting it at farolito.  but the carne asada was good.  carnitas was really something special.  their salsas are not as spicy so minus star.  i don't like beans in my burrito and they seemed cool with that. the place is clean, and they appear as though they even serve wine...  

but highlight of the evening?  these two mexican guys sitting at the table behind me. their platters arrive, whole carne asada, topped with salmon steaks, atop rice beans and a salad.  i'm not kidding.  wow. some kick ass looking surf and turf.  one guy says "hello mister sal-mon, how are you?  now i am going to eat you!! ahhhh!" and proceeds to take his first bite.  

i'm going back to try their shrimp, and maybe one of those salmon tacos...  if you're reading this and are like, seriously, you had Yat's po boy's for lunch and then burritos for dinner in one day?!? the answer is yes.
author: Nikki F.

description:
I came here with a couple friends and had a regular taco with mole chicken 
I thought 3 bucks was a bit on the high end for a single taqueria taco, but it was piled high, it tasted good (though I am no expert on the authenticity of mole sauces), and came with chips+salsa so I was definitely satisfied. This one taco constituted an entire meal for me.

My friend ordered a vege taco and it also came loaded. Unfortunately, one friend was not thrilled with her carne asada burrito.
The owner (I would imagine) also offered us some free ceviche as we paid the cashier, which was a sweet deal.
author: Kan L.

description: the food is good, kinda warm inside, nice wide open area and seating. the service was ok.
author: Raphy M.

description: Although my veggie burrito was smacked down with too much sour cream for my liking, the ingredients used were fresh and delicious, and my companion's taco looked (and tasted) quite divine, especially considering he shelled out a whopping 2.25+tax for it.  (Wtf!) Quite frankly, this taqueria is an amazing bang for the buck.
author: Karen K.

description: Wow - this Glen Park famous location now has another place on Mission Street.   This place is GOOD, FAST and CLEAN.    Believe me ... i know my tacos and this place is "muy bueno".   Tip - the quesidilla suiza is amazing...i promise.
author: Annabel G.

description: I can't imagine living somewhere else, where there was no place like Corneta. I've been to perhaps all of the mission burrito places, having lived there for 7 years, and some friends from nearby brought me here. It's big, clean, amazing, tons of variety, and makes a damn good carne asada super burrito. I finished up the half that I saved from last night, and had it for lunch. 2 meals: 6 dollars. And they have fresh avo, and the grilled meat is great.
author: Anna B.

description: Can you say bland?  I tried this place out because a friend of mine, who is Mexican, said it was good.  Well, he lied.  I tried the tacos al pastor, and it had no taste.  I did make the mistake of ordering a SUPER taco, so it was covered in guac, sour cream and beans, but I even scraped most of it off so I could just taste the meat alone (if it's good al pastor, the meat will speak for itself), but it was flavorless.  It tasted like pork that had been stewing for hours in WATER, with a little coloring added.  How sad.  It only got two stars because it was very, very clean.
author: Eileen H.

description:
as others have noted, la corneta is ultra clean and bright. it's like clorox with color protection. unfortunately, that's the best thing i can say about la corneta. don't get me wrong. the food is fine here, but with my love for papalote and my appreciation for pancho villa, la corneta seems like just another burrito in the mission.

huh, did i just declare a burrito war?
author: frisco j.

description: Totally decent burrito. I think the Carne asada super burrito at La Corneta is atleast as good as (and sometimes possibly better than) Farolitos. There is a lot of space to eat. If my mom ever visited me and for some reason wanted to eat a burrito in the mission I would probably take her here.
author: katharine s.

description: I came to La Corneta because a Mission native recommended it.  And was he right.  The ingredients were very fresh; the burrito was substantial, and the price was fair.  To top it off, the place is actually clean, amazingly so, and it's on the same block as that dump El Farolito. If you have the munchies when you get off BART at the 24th Street station, do yourself a favor and skip El Farolito, walk a little bit, and reward yourself.
author: John S.

description: My favorite Taqueria in San Francisco. The only place (along with the Glen Park location) my family gets their burritos, tacos, nachos, etc etc from. If i lived closer it is probably all I would eat. When I didnt live in San Francisco I would crave it. Not many places do Mexican like San Francisco does, and not many places in San Francisco do it like La Corneta.
author: Bobby P.

description: the cleanest, tastiest, affordable "tacqueria" on Mission in the heart of the Mission. When there's live music it is a complete experience! The quesadilla grande con pollo is decadent.
author: James-Jimm P.

description: For most restaurants with more than one location, I try to pick the one closest to home and stick with it.  For La Corneta, that location is Glen Park.  But the food is so good here that I had to try both.  Architecturally the Mission location is certainly more impressive, with a high-ceilinged dining room brilliantly lit by a skylight.  The food is just as good here--very Cal-Mex, which some people don't like, but sooo amazingly delicious, and with an impressive selection of meats.  And of course, the quesadillas deserve special mention--they really redefine what a quesadilla can be.
author: Wes M.

description: My roommate and I went here to meet up with an old friend from college. They get points for having Mexican Coke and being about the right price. I had a fish (salmon burrito) and it was pretty lackluster. The fish was okay-to-tasteless and the rest of the burrito was dry. I know purists will disagree, but I could have gotten a tastier burrito at Chipotle for cheaper. I've certainly had better burritos in the Mission for cheaper, at any rate.
author: Adam D.

description:
clean and spacious, nice wall murals with a big la virgen de guadalupe... i like the colors.
large taqueria style menu.
i like it alot because i can get a baby super burrito.  :)
author: charlotte s.

description: For San Francisco Mexican (which is really not Mexican food), La Corneta is great.  The food is fresh and the price is good.  Not the typical starchy San Francisco Burrito.  The prawns rock and the beer is cold.  My kids love this place.
author: Anthony K.

description:
This Taqueria is quite possibly the best of the Mission-style estabslishments in San Francisco. As they say, first impressions are of utmost importance, and the clean and bright interior quickly put your mind at ease, and let's face it, most taquerias in the city are breeding grounds for roaches and bacteria. (Cheers, Taqueria Cancun!) Here, everything is brightly painted and festive. The atmosphere is very inviting. 

The service is great and the food is prepared fresh everytime. The menu is standard fare, featuring huge burritos, quesadillas, tacos, and enchiladas. Choose the "super" option and they'll pile on an a coronary-inducing amount of guacamole, sour cream and cheese on top. The way they pack everything into one tortilla is truly an art form.

However, if you're looking for something exceptional, try the super fish tacos. They're made with fresh grilled salmon that's so tender, you actually wonder if it just swam upstream and onto your dinner plate. The fresh grated cheese, guacamole, pinto beans, rice, and salsa fresca are an incredibly good combination- for your eyes and your tastebuds! I ordered two of these, and it was more than enough. 

Try a mexican bottled Coke and a slice of flan (a sweet, pie-like dessert) and you've capped off what is sure to be an excellent meal.
author: Alex G.

description: There is nothing better than the smell of grilled carne asada when you walk in the door.  La Corneta has the best carne asada and camarones (prawns) burrito in the city of San Francisco. They dont skimp out on the carne asada and prawns at all. The prawns are huge. I had a a piece of prawn at every bite. Damn it's so f***kin good!
author: Chris M.

description: Fish tacos with salmon?  Hmm....I'm skeptical.  I like my fish white and flakey, but I'm open-minded so I was willing to give it a shot.  It was sooo good!  They grill a big ol piece of salmon so it gets a nice little crust on it.  It lays on a bed of rice, black beans, and tortillas.  Yum!  I don't feel heavy or weighed down like I normally do with one of the meats.  It's definitely not hole in the wall status - cleanest taqueria I've been to in the Mission for sure AND still delicious!!  I'll be coming here for more fish tacos in the near future.
author: Lynda N.

description: Soo good-soo cheap. Chicken Mole Taco is the way to go, and no gristle (unlike so many so-called great burrito places in the Mission). The chips aren't the best, but who needs them after a full plate of food for under $5?
author: Dani D.

description: This place is too clean.  It needs to be dirty.  This isn't an authentic taqueria.  I want to see rats and shit on the floor when I am eating my burrito.  I want to be in the dark guessing whether I am eating cow or cat.  The burritos here are decent but on the expensive side.  A steak and shrimp burrito is $10.  Crazyness.  One day I Was in I saw the quesadilla.  The next day I came back and ordered the carne asada super quesadilla.  I was disappointed.  It tasted like a burrito.  I need to try other meat from now on.
author: Fatty A.

description:
I guess I have a certain image of what a taqueria should be --- narrow, crowded, grungy-looking, but with a yummy menu (and bargain prices). So when a place like Pancho Villa and La Corneta come along, it's an interesting change of pace.

La Corneta is cheerily lit, clean, and has a nicely varied menu. Like me, you may miss it because the area is, um, not nearly as cheerily lit and clean. I was in the mood for salmon, so I came here and got the grilled salmon seafood special. Great dinner for nearly under 10 bucks (including tax). 

It's slightly pricier than a standard taqueria, but like Pancho Villa, this is a good place to hit up every so often for variety or special occasions.

Otherwise, El Farolito is just a few steps away.
author: Joseph R.

description: I love the Glen Park La Corneta.  Especially the grilled Chicken Burrito.  I have been eating there for years.  Always fresh always clean.  I don't even mind waiting in the long line.  Then last week, I tried the one on Mission Street.  The food was tasteless.  The staff was polite.  So polite that they could not even send away the scary (and smelly) homeless man standing in the restaurant with his pants around his ankles.
author: Mary H.

description: This burrito tastes like the inside of John Candy's coffin.
author: Rob D.

description: Sweet place! Food is great! Comes out super fast! And is delicious! there was an amazing band playing during lunch on Saturday. I had the super vegetarian burrito! So yummy! Great times, cheap price! Can't wait to go back!
author: Queen o.

description: i love this place. the food tastes incredibly fresh, the tacos especially are almost like a salad, and the salsa is delicious.
author: Lily S.

description: Man, I love the Chorizo Tacos here.  It's probably the best in the Bay Area.  I know that's a rather bold statement, but it's hard to find places that have good chorizo.  Granted I haven't checked out too many other restaurants in the mission, but this place is awesome.  Good seating for those busy lunch hours, great selection of food, and did i mention the chorizo tacos are freakin' AWESOME!  Come on over here and give it a try.  I promise you won't be disappointed.
author: James M.

description: Basic taqueria that gets two stars because its clean and relatively cheap.  The chips are actually really good, and so are the nachos.  The rest of the food lacks any real soul.  Get some chips and then go get a burrito from Farolito.
author: Matt S.

description: wow! great tacqueria. i got a number 3, a huuuge rice plate with beef, steak, meat, chips, and a bunch of other mexian goodies. got a strawberry aqua fresca which was delicious too! you can watch them cook your food as you order, very fresh ingredients, completely freshly cooked and hot and steamy food. very great service, very nice employees. a live mariachi band was also present, which made my visit even more grand. my first time there, and definitely coming back! great experience!
author: michelle w.

description: Fresh, delicious Mexican food in a clean and cutely decorated restaurant...hell yes! I come here all the time and it's my favorite in the Mission.
author: Natasha F.

description: This taqueria in the mission is both my wife and my favorite burrito joint.  Many will take a walk down the street and go to El Farolito for the "perfect" burrito but I only make that walk at times of 1am and drunk.  The prawn and steak super burrito here is excellent as is any of their prawn dishes.  Make sure to put a bit of the Valentino sauce on any dish you get.  You won't regret it!
author: Swarup B.

description: La Corneta is a good place to get a burrito.  It's relatively cheap and while the line is often long, it usually moves pretty quick.  I've fallen in love with their Veggie Tostadas, which come in one of those huge tortilla "bowl" thingies and are piled with cheese, sour cream and guacamole that you don't get charged "super" for.  Wow, y'all have come up with some great monikers for this place i.e. "foxy taco" and "a clean, well lighted place for burritos."
author: Ben V.

description: This is THE place to get mushroom quesidillas. They are cheap and delicious. Its also very clean, and sometimes they have a really endearing keyboard and drum duet which just makes things feel happy.
author: Prasant R.

description:
I was visiting friends over the weekend and we ate here. The restaurant is in the midst of a bunch of random shops and the streets are busy so it would be difficult to find parking if you were driving. It was quite busy on a sunday afternoon at 3-ish, but the line goes fast and looking at the food makes you drool because they make it all right in front of you. Heaps of cheese, veggies, beans, salsa. Beauty. We all ordered baby burittos and could not finish them. What looked really really good was the grilled mushroom and shrimp that even my vegetarian friend said looked good, and grilled burittos that they grill so they're crispy on the outside.  Lots of seafood options, and everything was clean and fresh. Tables are stocked with squirt bottles of red or green salsa, which helps start arguements about which kind tastes better.
It was very clean like everyone has mentioned and they had live musicians performing. Fun atmosphere and good food. Definitely recommend it and want to go back soon.
author: Jasmine O.

description:
LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Super baby fish burrito is delicious (made with fresh salmon not nasty fried filet-o-fish that some "tacquerias" serve).  The horchata (spelling is probably wrong b/c I'm a white girl) is like liquified bread pudding.  Quac is tasty as well.  This place uses quality ingredients and you can really taste the difference.

La Corneta has colorful murals, mariachi bands on occasion and decent bathrooms to boot.
author: AngelaS F.

description:
The food here is good but they don't understand "No Cheese."
I've said it 3 times and they still put cheese.  I don't get it: "No" means the same thing in English and Spanish.

I just go to the Glen Park location instead.
author: Jolene L.

description: While I know many people who swear by El Farolito when they're looking for a burrito, my vote goes to La Corneta.  Why?  Super Baby Burrito.  At only a few cents more than the price of a Regular burrito at El Farolito, the Super Baby Burrito has all the fixins, and in my opinion it is a more manageable quantity.  All of their ingredients seem to be of a very good quality.  Also, good chips.
author: Chadwick W.

description: Probably one of my favorite taquerias in the Mission. I usually get two tacos  - al pastor or grilled chicken. Prawn tacos I hear are pretty delicious too. They have all sorts of food here..big "Super" plates  as well if your into getting a big plate of rice, beans, guac, and meat.
author: Christian S.

description: For burritos I usually head down 16th Street way,  but this is my quesadilla place. They don't skimp on the ingredients and they are nice and crispy and bursting at the seams. I usually get the super prawn quesadilla. The staff is a little salty but I like their no nonsense move em in move em out attitude. Don't get in line until you know what you want or you'll suffer the scorn of those who take your order displayed fully in the raised arch of an artfully penciled brow line.
author: Pam D.

description:
This is good. Not the best Mexican in town, but veeery good.
I love their quesadilla suiza.
author: Peppe R.

description:
been here twice, liked it immensely. 

1st time: fish quesadilla was BIG, cheesy, and delicious, especially with their spicy salsa.

2nd time: fish taco was a bit too small for me. i left still feeling hungry.

however, while i was satisfied with the food, i was rather unhappy with the service and the way you order.

may be a tad pricey, but... hey, the food's good!

i can't wait to try everything else though.
author: Inari T.

description: much better than last time i was here, the burrito was actually neat , not greasy at all, more like papalote or little chihuaha quality only cheaper of course but it is up to that standard for sure
author: NAEL K.

description: I don't know about this place anymore.. maybe I have been coming here too often.. or is it the economy...everything on their menu shrunk... and it the quality.. just went down hill...
author: Monika T.

description: I love the fact that you can order a baby burrito here.  I can never finish a regular.  As far as flavor, it is lacking a bit in this department but i can't quite put my finger on it. Let's talk about the rice-lose the peas and carrots please this isn't fried rice people!  I prefer the one on Diamond but both locations are clean.  Infact, so clean it smells like PineSol instead of Mexican food, but oh well!   I give 3 stars for cleanliness and baby burrito option.
author: anne m.

description: Nice clean place to sit down and have a cheap meal that won't dissolve your stomach lining.  I tried the salmon taco -- salmon was overcooked and a bit rubbery, but it's a lot of meat for $4.  Also tried a chicken tamale, which was on the stale side and again a bit overcooked into polenta jell-o.  Compared to El Farolito, this place is excellent, but I would rather walk down the street to La Taqueria where the taco veggies are amazingly fresh.
author: Dave S.

description: Very clean & shiny inside - it immediately made me think of Pancho Villa, both in cleanliness and in general layout.  Large assortment of meats & selections.  The mole chicken is reasonably tasty with a richly flavored sauce, but in my opinion the sauce is a bit thin.  The chicken, however, was very good and high quality. The biggest disadvantage is that they don't seem to have a good salsa bar, and the 2 salsas they toss in with a take-out order leave a lot to be desired.  They're rather bland.
author: Don H.

description: Decent quick bite before a show or going out - everything tasted fresh, and the staff tries hard to please. Bottomless homemade chips and a nice assortment of salsas keep coming throughout the meal. Be clear about what you order, some items in our foursome got lost in translation. Other than that, a good place for fresh mex.
author: P C.

description:
so tres chinos sat down for chips, salsa, and a corona while waiting for a bunch of their slow poke friends... and noticed tres gringos doing the same.  being cinco de mayo and all we felt it necessary to grab a burrito and some cervezas and la corneta taqueria would have to do since it's got a ton of room.  to be fair, it's hard to get a 5-star rating for mexican from me in the bay area as i went to school in san diego.  this place is good, but not great.

first impressions.  big glass windows and it's clean. super clean.  TOO CLEAN. as such, i didn't expect much from the food.  i usually judge a taqueria by it's carnitas... which was indeed up to snuff.  however, it was enclosed in a hackjob of a tortilla enclosure.  and has anyone else noticed that their rice looks like some chinese fried rice you might find in your grocer's freezer aisle?  the salsa was blah... not blech, but blah.  where was the kick?

overall, the place isn't dirty enough for me... but it massages the taste buds just enough.  given that el farolito is on the same block, i'm not likely to return.
author: Steven C.

description: I give La Corneta 4 stars for cleanliness, but when you are in the Mission and want a good burrito, head down the street to La Taqueria. The meat was tough, the toppings were sparse, and the staff was unfriendly. Never again will I get duped into coming to this place for convenience purposes only!
author: Susan L.

description:
okay, see, this is what im talking about.

all the hype surrounding Taqueria Cancun - no, nada, boo.

hearty servings of full flavor here. great for what you pay. clean and roomy. im not a burrito guy, nachos usually get my money, but their burrito was surprisingly tasty.

La Corneta Taqueria. for those in need of a taqueria, minus the hipsters and hype.
author: Darrell L.

description: The place is Ok. Not great. Too much stuff on the taco and sometimes they can't hear your order above the din of everybody in the restaurant. I once ordered a shrimp taco and they cooked me up a shrimp plate instead AND I ordered in Spanish, I was pretty confused to say the least. Whatever. The quesadillas are the most greasiest I've ever had, even greasier than El Farolito.
author: Gina R.

description: This is my favorite taqueria in SF for sure. The mild salsa is AMAZING!!! They are always really generous with the avocado as well. The prices are super reasonable. Thank you La Corneta.
author: Elizabeth J.

description: Great Mexican food in the heart of the Mission.  I had a beef taco and a chicken tamale.  Both were fantastic and the meat was great in both - I am particular about mystery meat and this was not that!  Both were fresh.  I had some beers with some friends, listened to the mariachi band, and had a nice Saturday afternoon!  It's also a nice atmosphere inside the restaurant, especially for a taqueria.  The bathrooms were CLEAN, too, always a good sign.
author: K V.

description: A friend introduced me to La Corneta and I'm very glad she did. The super burrito was huge yet I did come close to finishing it. The carnitas was very tender and plentiful throughout the entire burrito. Next time I want to try the prawns as they smelled amazing while waiting for my order. Bonus: Live music, a two piece mexican band played some good tunes while we enjoyed our overstuffed burritos...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I've had nothing but good experiences with this place. They seem to take pride in their business, and the food is good, especially the prawn-related items. Not the cheapest, but you get what you pay for
author: Josh K.

description: Love the prawn super burrito in a spinach wrap. If you're stopping by my place, please pick one up for me. kthnx
author: wendy p.

description: Love at first bite.  Seriously.  I was fiending for some La Taqueria but since just about everything along Mission was closed I wandered into La Corneta.  Relatively busy?  Check!  Clean-ish?  Check!  Food looks good and fresh? Check!  I placed my order for the super carna asata burrito with the works. I also order a simply corn quesadilla and Chile RELLENO to go.  They had so many good offerings - including seafood selections which you can't find everywhere. For dessert a chocolate, flan layer cake! Can you believe that every.single.thing was delicious?  Fresh, yummy, perfect.  I have a new favorite.  Yeah!!!!
author: Dee B.

description: The 'baby' size burritos are plenty, like ordering the mini plate at a Hawaiian place. The lengua is delicious: nice, tender, and flavorful. The cookies are pretty good too, not too sweet.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Great salmon burritos (order the "Super Fish Burrito"), steak quesadillas and salsa, plus the decor is very attractive. My one big issue is that the cashier/checkout is usually pretty disorganized, with the staff trying to ring up customers while simultaneously helping out behind the food counter, fielding demands from restaurant customers who've suddenly remembered they want chips or drinks, or weirdly abandoning their post to wander back into the kitchen.  But that's really my only issue, otherwise I love La Corneta and go there every week.
author: Marisa R.

description: You can raise your prices, or reduce your portion size- but not both.   It used to be enough food for me, but for almost five dollars, their 'baby burrito" would now leave a toddler hungry. Love the mural, and the live music, but for take-out, I'm going elsewhere.
author: Linda F.

description: That's funny, we also call it "A Clean Well-Lighted Place for Burritos."
author: Tres S.

description: Yum!  This is a great mexican restaurant....it's really clean, it's big, and the food is good!  I highly recommend the quesadillas or burritos.  My friend had the nachos, which were good, but got soggy very fast because of all the toppings.  The only downside is that, like everywhere else in the Mission, parking is hard to find....I'd suggest taking Bart or a cab if you can.
author: Shannon E.

description: The surf and turf platter looked real good, but got a fish taco instead.It was a big ol chunk of salmony goodness. And out of town visitor scarfed a whole burrito down, then started eyeballing my taco! I don't care if she is lactating, she needs to get her own!
author: Krismet C.

description: Want a spanking clean, large restaurant to take the kids or fam. this place is it. The burritos taste fine, this place usually has a line. check out the pictures to see.
author: Cooter Z.

description: The burritos kinda suck, considering the other options in the neighberhood.  But the low credit card minimum and the awesome fresh taco options more than make up for the fact that the burritos are lackluster.....
author: Francis K.

description: I'm giving La Corneta a 5 because it must be pretty good for me to eat there 1-3 times per week.  I work  2 blocks away and it's the most reliably tasty and fast place I go.  Almost always, the tacos and burritos are great -- I'm a prawn baby burrito or prawn taco girl.
author: Amy E.

description: La Corneta is Pretty good but, Only if you like Very Authentic Mexican Food. The Carne Asada Burrito tastes to dull and plain.For me, the food  there doesn't have the real Mexican Food taste like at the Taco Trucks!But it's really clean inside and the staff are Friendly.
author: Sergio C.

description: Love the super baby burrito! The employees can be a bit rough around the edges but the end result is great.
author: Caroline S.

description: I was very disappointed with the service provided.  I placed an order for work to celebrate 5 De Mayo.  It started on a bad note.  In the past we have used  this taqueria for the service and good food.  This time they really blew it. When I placed the order (30 burritos) I asked if we can have salsa and chips since in the past these was included the fellow who took my order said no and if we wanted salsa and chips we had to pay.  I went ahead and added to the price of the order.  We received the order  one hour late, the burritos were cold and the chips delivered was a bag of chips that you buy at Costco for$3.00. How tacky is that. Needless to say the entire office asked we do not order from here again.
author: A. D.

description: i love this place! we got lucky and parked right in front! they are fast...I love that you get to choose what kind of beans you get in your super burrito..sometimes you feel like black and sometimes you feel like refried...lol
author: alessandra t.

description: Great food, wonderful value.  The hard thing about La Corneta is what to choose.  The carnitas, hands down, are consistently amazing.  Wonderful flavor, tender, melt-in-your-mouth quality.  The chile rellenos are great also.  And then, you have to also try the shrimp & mushroom quesadilla.  Ah...and don't forget to wash it down with a Bohemia!
author: babsie g.

description: The bright and colorful oasis in the neighbourhood, with backdrops of sky and beach scenes skillfully painted using primary colors. The long menu of options. Not at all bad place to order fish tostada with fried beans, and follow up with Negra Modelo.
author: Anya B.

description: I love their super baby grilled chicken burritos! The one in Glen Park is the only burrito game in the neighborhood, but even so, they've got some tasty burritos. The salmon was once a bit under-done, but otherwise no problems. Yum
author: Johann K.

description: I stop by here, usually repeatedly, whenever I'm in San Francisco.  The prawn taco is awesome (note: not the Super Prawn, which is just piled with unnecessary, distracting embellishments).  The asada and al pastor are good, too.  They are generous with the meat.  Two tacos are usually enough for my appetite, although I always order more, knowing that once I'm back in Seattle l won't be finding anything quite the same.
author: Jon C.

description: Everything that I have ordered here are all excellent quality and my fave is the super chicken quesadilla.  It's busy but worth the wait.
author: Jay S.

description: good food and great customer service. kind prices and greasy chips... just the way i like them. i also enjoy the live music that often frequents the halls of this very clean taqueria. nice mural painting too. try the quesadilla
author: Jim L.

description:
The carne asada is ok
The grilled chicken is better then most in SF
The Carnitas is quite good 

If you order a "fish" taco, burrito, quesadilla ... the fish will be Salmon.

I think there specialty is fish and shrimp entrees. They also add mushrooms to a lot of entrees. 

My oder is usually "regular nachos, no beans, with carnitas" sometimes I'll add avacado or guacamole and chicken instead of carnitas.
author: Henry C.

description: FRESH, fresh ingredients!  When I frequent this place I always have to have the chile relleno with their aguas frscas. Not once have I been disappointed.
author: josue p.

description: I went on my first date with my husband here.  Now we go on a regular basis.  I love to watch the man at the grill.  He brings stacks and stacks of meat from the kitchen and cooks to perfection.  The women who make our orders are hard working and wow do they make a super burrito.  (That's what its called.  tee hee) Check out the weekends - always a live band.
author: Sarah W.

description: Super fish tostada is great. love the Guadalupe mural.
author: Sia V.

description: My favorite Mexican food place in San Francisco!!!!  The quality of the food is THE BEST. I never get tired of eating at La Corneta Taqueria! I also like them because you don't have to go though any hassle (no asking for a key or stupid buzzers) to use the restroom so you can just use the restroom go wash your hands before eating.  I get hungry just thinking about this place.
author: Sydney A.

description: People are right, this is a very colorful and vibrant restaurant. This is where the good part ends. Food is bland and forgettable. No spices, no zing, no flavor. This is suppose to be authentic Mexican food? I've had better from Chevy's. It's expensive, but then they do give you good sized portions. Ambiance is loud and sometimes uncomfortable (courtesy of the creepy old male customers scoping out the ladies).However, what really irks me are the looks I get from the female workers cooking up the food in the grill line thing. I swear, I ask them to make my order and they look at me like they have a piece of sh*t under their noses. This hasn't happened once or twice, it happens EVERY time that I come here. Please get some friendlier workers. Until that happens, enough is enough. So long La Corneta, hello El Farolito.
author: Elly C.

description: Inconsistent.  The first time I ate there, I loved it.  The second and third time I didn't.  I ordered the same each time.  I think it was fresh the first time and had been sitting a while the second and third time.  I won't go back.
author: Nora S.

description:
One of the two or three best Mexican restaurants in the city.  I love Mexican food and have tried, literally, hundreds of Mexican restaurants in the Bay Area and I always come back to this one.  Unlike some of the other good ones, La Corneta is totally reliable--you know if you order the carnitas burrito that you will get the carnitas burrito that you wanted.

The prices are great, the restaurant is not only clean but large and I love the skylight and wall murals in the back half.  The bathrooms are also clean--an amazing feat in the restaurant world of The Mission.

The staff is pleasant, the line moves quickly, the portions are large, and you know what you get.  I'm so happy that in a world of ever-changing restaurants with ever-changing quality that La Corneta is sailing along.
author: Murray S.

description:
I'm giving La Corneta on Mission one star in a lame attempt to knock it down a peg.

You see, the food is good.  I keep going there for the food.  IF ONLY THEY COULD EVER GET MY ORDER RIGHT OR EVEN TRY!

I speak Spanish, they get it wrong.  I speak English, they get it wrong.  They ask me many times, and I tell them many, many times, and they still get it wrong.  I'm not difficult.  I usually order nachos, and they get it wrong!  They act as if I am a problem and not a customer.  They have basically NO customer service, and no care.  Oh wait, there is one young woman who works there who gets my order right. ONE!

The La Corneta in Glen Park, four and a half stars, but the staff on Mission SUCKS.
author: Nathan K.

description:
How much do  I love this place? Let me lis the ways:

- HUGE Borritos
- HUGE Quesadillas
- SMALL Prices

I swear the quesadillas are the size of a deflated football. The Borritos are the size of my forearm and weight about the size of a good sized dictionary. 

Surprisingly this is a very clean place. Now if you haven't been "anywhere" in the mission, most of the place you go, to eat or shop is DIRTY. This place is very clean, well lit and the staff comes out to clean your table after you leave. 

I wouldn't venture in this area late at night so don't come eat here too late. You might slip into a boritto coma and find yourself sleeping in the street on Mission Street. Which isn't a very calming situation to find yourself in.
author: mark h.

description: The mission district is really ew to me and I was blown away on how interesting and so diverse the area is. I was hooked when my friend brought me to this place El Corneta . I had the shrimp and beef quesadilla and I was hooked. The Tortilla was moist and delicious that had a generous filing. Plus an added bonus they  had live music
author: PIco S.

description: I have to say, the food was pretty decent, but it was as loud as a goddamn public pool.  I like the giant Virgin Mary but otherwise, it's a food court in search of a mall.  There's near-infinite high quality Mexican within a 500-yard radius; why scream to be heard?
author: Pete K.

description: My dear Super Shrimp Quesadilla, will you marry me?
author: mike h.

description: The food is good, the Mission location is very busy and the order staff girls are bored to death and OFTEN get the order wrong. On the phone fifty percent of the time your order is wrong. The portions have shrunk over the years and the food used to be GREAT now its above average. The Glen Park location has nicer staff but even smaller portions though they are better at getting phone orders right.
author: alex b.

description: oh, i miss the mission...  i used to work just up the street and corneta was MY fave (at that end of the mission, anyway!) though the rest of the office preferred the belly bombs of el farolito.  the fish (salmon) taco is amazing, especially with the black beans and fresh salsa - just one, and maybe some chips - was the perfect affordable, filling, fairly-healthy lunch.
author: April C.

description: Restaurant-quality food, taqueria prices/efficiency. Humongous portions. Actually has really good (and fresh!) salmon and prawns, which is lacking from most taquerias' repertoires . Lots of room to sit and enjoy. Only drawback- salsa is usually old (u know that when it tastes slightly carbonated and tangy). When fresh, their chips and salsa are very good.  Nachos are huge and orgasmic. Dishes are made in front of you so its easy to customize. Friendly staff.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I'm a regular.  The super taco is very large -- and it's a bargain!  I just like this place cause it's clean and quick.
author: G P.

description: The only reason to come here is if you just can't bring yourself to eat at a taqueria with a little dirt.  Bins of meat sitting in liquid for hours thrown on top of a sloppily assembled STEAMED tortilla.  They don't get much right. Go somewhere without bins of meat if you can.  You wouldn't eat a steak that had been sitting in a pile in juice for hours, why is it acceptable when the steak is cut up?
author: Jose W.

description: this is my favorite burrito joint in the post maya (rip 4 -eva) wasteland that is san francisco. the salsa makes it! hail the new salsa!
author: mike t.

description: We call this taqueria "the clean place" because it's relatively new and the bathrooms are not a hazmat zone.  In the crowded pantheon of Mission taquerias, Corneta deserves notice because their fish burritos use salmon.  Salmon!!  It's not lean, cheap junk meat either:  they use quality salmon and big pieces of it, too.  I don't know if salmon is a part of traditional Mexican cuisine, but it sure makes itself at home in a burrito, quesadilla, or taco.  Another thing I like about Corneta is that they offer the option of the "baby" burrito for a dollar less.  Don't get me wrong, the baby burritos are still extremely filling.  They also offer a range of agua frescas, including mango which is an oh-so-perfect match to spicy food.  They have a pretty extensive menu, so they had to use small lettering to fit it all on the wall; you're better off grabbing a takeout menu to make your choice.  Aside from "the clean place" this place is also nicknamed "foxy taco" because the ladies who work here are all so very foxy.
author: maiko h.

description: Great taqueria.  Recommend the shrimp quesadilla, shrimp platter, or really, anything with shrimp (these guys really know how to do shrimp) or the tostada (with any meat.)  If you aren't super hungry, even the regular tacos are great.  This is the type of Taqueria that has a team of young Latinas preparing your food in a clean and totally visible kitchen.  How cool is that?  Drawback:  Can be noisy here, especially when the mariachis come.  Also, stay away from the carne --- I've ordered it a couple times and the taste and tenderness are reminiscent of an old leather shoe.
author: David M.

description: hands down the best baby burritos in existence (meaning enough food for the average human). i suggest the baby super prawn. yes, that may seem confusing, but in reality it's just a small awesomely tasty prawn burrito. they aren't afraid of using butter here and i love them for it. the super chicken nachos are great to split among two or three people. add a couple mexican cokes and you got a great start to a great date.
author: lucy m.

description: Excellent, excellent! The healthiest and quickest access to great food if you're coming out of 24th Street BART.
author: Jenny A.

description: The food is decent but not great. They really need to learn how to wrap a Burrito. It seems they prefer to fold the tortilla instead of rolling it and then use a lot of foil to stem the outward flow of the burrito's contents. Another thing that is annoying about this place is that, when getting a burrito, they don't melt the cheese. Instead, they just mix it with the sour cream and salsa; resulting in a half warm half cold burrito. However, the entrees are better than the burritos and priced well.
author: Jorge C.

description: my absolute fave for 5 years time now. whenever i get back in the country it's my first stop after dropping off the backpack. always clean, and i super appreciate the live music at lunchtime!
author: UrbanEmpress G.

description: there's s*loads of taquerias in the mission, but i keep going back to la corneta. i rarely trust seafood in taquerias...but la corneta has awesome prawns and salmon. the baby burritos are nice too for those who don't want to have to tote the other half of their burrito around all night while partying in the mission. also they've got some excellent marinated meats--spicy chicken in roja and verda salsas, and the chile verde pork is tasty too. probably my favorite dish though is the super steak and prawn quesadilla--with their tomatillo salsa slathered all over it...all washed down with an agua fresca melon juice. scrumptious...
author: dusty d.

description: i think this is actually my favorite mexican place in the city right now. it's really clean and well lit. which is weird. maybe a little too weird. but the best thing i like about it is the fact that the prices are reasonable and you get a lot for what you order. good vegetarian options! also, they have cake.
author: Oleya P.

description: I got their tacos-- one chicken, the other carnitas. I made the mistake of not getting them with guacamole, which made them a little dry, so I got back in line to get some. Just as I took out the 70 cents to pay for it, the lady behind the counter told me "No, its fine." I was shocked. Its such a rare thing to get freebies and be treated so nicely around here...and it pays off for their business-- I was going to give 3 stars but their generosity bumped it up to 4.
author: L. Renee D.

description: yum!  i only ever order their seafood.  either the shrimp or the salmon.  not because the other stuff isn't good.  i hear it is.  it is just that the seafood is so good, i can't help myself but order it every time.  usually it's the "super prawn quesadilla".  oh yeah, their guacamole is also amazing.  and not surprisingly, the line to order is always out the door. but it moves quick.
author: Jason H.

description: I accidentally stumbled to this location when I was looking for la taqueria. Portion wise the food was a lot bigger than their Glen Park location but the food wasn't as tasteful.However, the location is 5 times larger than the Glen Park location and is easier to seat a large or small party.
author: Brian W.

description: This place is awesome!  I love Mexican food and this place exemplifies it for me!  It's not a fancy dine-in per se, but who cares?  The place is CLEAN, the food is MUCHO DELICIOSO and the chicks preparing the burritos behind the glass counter are HOTTIES.  This place could be a Mexican style Hooters if they let the women walk around to serve tables.  Try their al pastor burritos!
author: Raging R.

description: see, my philosophy for good ass mexican food is the more south you go in cali, the better."  now bein in nor cal, given that theory, you dont want to expect too much. the native chicanos are so distant and displaced the food served here is almost imagined sense of home. okay i'm being a little dramatic. lets just say, growing up with LA taquerias, my pallate doesnt big me too often to jumpstreet over the mission and fall in line. HOWEVER, if i was to get a little sompin- it'll definitely be a La Corneta Taqueria. Mainly, because from the jump, it has impressed me with the freshness- esp. anything seafood there. not wimpy not skimpy seafood. just like baja califas standards. juicy salmon burritos (agh! foggitaboutit, it's so delicious), prawn tacos (plump!), etc.  On a foggy day, you'll even appreciate the brightly colored walls and live music. So big love to La Corneta por vida, homes.
author: irie o.

description: Nice ass place. Like Pancho Villa but in a new building. The tostada is damn good.
author: Hmmm W.

description: Love the food here. I feel you get a really good value. The super baby burritos and super tacos are excellent. The only reason that I am not giving this a full 5 stars is due to the fact that the live music they had playing there was way too loud--so it was hard to communicate with the servers and to have a relaxing meal
author: alexandria s.

description: Great burrito place in the heart of the mission.  I prefer this place to Pancho Villa and they have the best rice -- it has peas and carrots in it! You can choose your tortilla and beans and they'll make a custom burrito to order for next to nothing.  Sometimes there are communication difficulties if you 're a picky eater like me; English is spoken well by only a few but its worth it for the burritos.  The enchilladas are also recoomened along with their juices and horchata.
author: Mike G.

description: I thought it was kind of weird having peas in the rice. For a second, it looked like they were putting chinese fried rice when they were making my burrito. Also, it would've been nice if they had a salsa bar like some of the other taquerias in the area have. Other than that, the burrito was okay.
author: Justagentlemen U.

description:
always a line, decently clean, and amazingly delicious mexican food.  huge portions, as other yelpers have mentioned, and cheap prices.  

love love love the food, warrants a drive out to the mission for it, even though parking is a bear.  

yum - craving the shrimp quesadilla right now....
author: John E.

description: Holy Shit their sangria is off the hook, fresh fruit inside a glass of wine that is aged, is was unbelievable! We walked in here last saturday after our photo shoot for our album and i was welcomed with smiles, great smelling food and great service. The woman working the register is gorgeous by the way and she is very effecient with her work. Give her a raise folks! I had gotten a super burrito with pastor and it was flavorful, fresh and filling and those are my 3 f's that i do not use often.  Even though this was not the best burrito i have ever had in my whole life, it's fo sho up there! I have been going to la corneta since the location in diamond first opened and this place is just as good and one of the best spots in mission. La Altena is still the best on mission tho for just a burrito but you have to go after 8 pm when the good cooks there. Here at la corneta, you get the works of great things, like very clean restrooms, great service and the best sangria! for that i will give more business and better rankings to LA CORNETA!
author: supa m.

description: this place has some good menudo!!!! Havent been there in awhile...but they use to make it spicy...luv it!!!!
author: m p.
